text:
It's ok. I went on a week day at the end of breakfast, so it wasn't too busy. Still, service was scattered and the kitchen slow. 

I had a veggie breakfast burrito, the man had a more traditional breakfast. The burrito was .  . . edible. It was enormous, big enough to feed me for a day and still have leftovers. Inside a soggy tortilla I had mounds of scrambled eggs and about 2 pounds of vegetables - onions, peppers, avocado, tomato, hashbrowns, and then some. Most of the vegetables tasted very, very steamed, and then doused in grease. There wasn't much taste to them at all, and I love my vegetables. It makes me sad someone discovered a way to make them taste so uninteresting. On top of the whole affair was their spanish sauce (tomato paste?) and an unmelted square of orange cheese-like product. All in all, it didn't taste bad, but that's not high praise for restaurant food.

His breakfast was easily as big, and looked much better than mine tasted. The waitress got the order close, but not quite right, and he didn't have the interest to send it back. It was good, but too greasy for him to eat very much of it.

If it were cheaper I would say it was a good value. As it stands, I would go if someone really wanted to go there, but if its left to me there are many other places I'd go for breakfast first.

Under omelets, it said "frittata". So... is it a frittata or an omelet?

It's an omelet with lots of vegetables in it. So good with breakfast potatoes. 

There is a line to get in but it moves fast. It helps if you buy snacky stuff out on the street beforehand. We sat way back at the counter and it was perfect. Nice and quiet.

I f'n loved Pittsburgh.
This is the real deal. Long lines outside but be patient. Super busy, friendly service, and a great diner breakfast. The hot sausage is particularly good.
Unbelievably bad service to the point where it can't taste good enough to be worth it. Also coffee is literally hot water- just nasty and all decaf.

Passing by this morning I stepped through the crowd and went to the bar as per usual. Done this at least 5 times before presuming that people are waiting for a table which they usually are.  After five minutes of sitting there I was informed that I must go to the back of the line outside. So go and wait outside for a good 30 minutes for one seat at the bar?  At the time there were at least 10 empty seats at the bar.
I strolled on to Kelly's which is where I was originally going in the first place. Walked in, sat at the bar, had breakfast. It doesn't seem that complicated but times have changed apparently.

No trip to the Strip/Pittsburgh is complete without a pit stop at DeLuca's for breakfast!

First things first, you're going to have to wait in line to get seated, there's usually no way around it, but TRUST ME it's well worth the wait! DeLuca's advertises "Best Breakfast in town" and they strongly back up that statement with their food!

For people who live the fitness lifestyle like myself not eating what you want can be torturous! DeLuca's does however offer up some meals to suit fitness conscience people with offering their "BodyBuilders Breakfast". But you better believe that when I'm in DeLuca's it's time for a cheat meal! I usually go with a Hot Sausage, Egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on Manci's Italian Bread. Then I dive into an order on their amazing hot cakes! Usually the Rece's cup or Cinnamon Bun. 

Overall take it from a Yinzer and try this place out

Great service, great food.
Perfect diner for those who want to take them time with breakfast.

I am not a fan of diners, but this place was great.  They don't win people over with high quality ingredients, but who cares when it tastes this good!  Service was great, seated right away.  Cash only.  Great breakfast burritos and sweet breakfast options.

Decided to give Deluca's a try one Sunday for lunch because we were on the strip and I was in the mood for breakfast/brunch food.  Overall, I'd have to say that I left thinking it was nothing special and, later, feeling like it was very overhyped, when I found out Deluca's is somewhat of a Pittsburgh Icon.

Food was ok, but I did find HAIR IN MY FRENCH TOAST.  Which of course, made things rather unappealing, even after a new order was brought to me.

Service was average to poor.  The server didn't seemed to be too shocked or sorry about the fact that there was hair in my food.
classic pittsburgh, i think. amazing crepes and fresh squeezed oj. crazy busy, so that's a good sign!

Amazing. Best breakfast I have had in pgh. Awesome atmosphere and staff. Greek eggs Benedict is absolutely the best Benedict I have ever had. The only downfall is if you go after 10 on weekends you will have a 40 minute wait - well worth it.

My girlfriend and I have been here and it seems to be pretty average overall.  The food was ok, but nothing spectacular.  I think it falls a little short of the hype.  Breakfast is a cherished event and we just expected a little more from the food and service.  Both were good, but definitely not anything excellent.  Chorizo was not that good.  Pancakes might be a better bet.

You just beat the food  here for breakfest.  The environment is also a treat if you have never been here.  The choices are more than ample and the servings are generous.  Give it a try and you won't be sorry.

After walking past the long Saturday lines numerous times, I brought the kids here on a week day.  Great idea.  No wait, and no hurry.  The pancakes were excellent..light, fluffy, and perfect.  The omelet with Chorizo?  Horrid, but I blame myself.   What was I thinking?  Like ordering oysters in Iowa.  

Good cup of diner coffee, and counter service was great.  Kids want to know when we're coming back...soon!
Such a great place for food that is like making it from scratch! U won't be disappointed going here! Go early it gets busy cause it's that good.

DON'T BELIEVE THE OTHER REVIEWS OR HYPE!!! Came here while on a trip, and waited in line for about an hour. Finally, got seated in a dirty little booth near the back, where I had a constant view of a ridiculous ceiling fan (a box fan hanging from the ceiling). I'll tolerate a hole in the wall for good food, but this didn't even come close to delivering. The food was simply not good. I ordered a breakfast burrito that was looked as bad as it tasted, including the kraft singles artistically placed on top. 

Our service was nothing short of bizarre, I suspect drugs and I'm not kidding. The order came out wrong and the interaction was manic.

Last year began the tradition of going to DeLuca's every time my family visits from Minneapolis. The hotel we stay at (Homewood Suites) recommended it and they offer a free shuttle to and from it. 

The service is always welcoming and friendly. Our server, Nicole, was super sweet, personable and attentive. 

Last year I had an amazing omelet that spanned the edges of the plate. This time I had an egg and cheese sandwich on Mancini's Italian bread (the BEST bread in the world!) with their crispy home fries. My sister had pancakes that were bigger than her hand. They were perfectly  fluffy and slightly crispy on the edges. 

Best of all, the prices are very reasonable and all proceeds of any DeLuca's gift purchase (coffee mug, shirt, etc.) goes to non-profit animal rescues! (The menu includes a very important reminder to spay or neuter your pets : )

They aren't kiddin when they say this is the best breakfast in Pittsburgh. This was my second trip and it just may become a tradition on every visit. This time I got the dessert pancakes that consisted of strawberry ice cream, chocolate chip pancakes, chocolate fudge and caramel sauce. It was amazing but almost too sweet (if that's even a real thing). It was tough to take down before the ice cream melted but I had fun trying! I highly recommend this place. Be prepared to wait a while to get in though. The lines are long but for good reasons.

Great local Pittsburghesque Diner.  I had delicious pumpkin pancakes with eggs and "kielbasy".  Very good, the kielbasy was not like any I had before, I suppose all kielbasa has it's own local flavor.

Interesting people watching, from the locals, tourists, tattooed staff and Pittsburgh's finest.   Everything is cooked behind a low counter - you can see all the activity - looks crazy back there.  The booths are not very comfortable, straight backed and Formica topped (adds to the charm?)  There is a strange mural on the wall, Greek mythology themed with Pan and others, labeled as a prop from the movie "Passed Away".

Really enjoyed it, would go back and recommend to others.  Fun and funky area to shop too.

Truthfully I don't understand what the whole hubbub is about this place. It's yummy for sure...some of the better eggs benedict and coffee I've had around these parts but an hour wait? Really? I went to Deluca's a few times (truthfully out of the urgings of a nytimes article) and was pretty disappointed each visit. It's just ok food, ok atmosphere, and bad service. 

Come to jersey I'll show you a good breakfast.

The breakfast burrito and Belgian waffle sundae were great.  The service was quick and the coffee was tasty and plentiful.  My only regret is that I didn't eat more.  If you get a chance it's worth a shot, the menu is very diverse.

I had really hopes for this place. We waited in line for about 20 minutes. A couple behind us told us it would be well worth it. Interesting enough, the wait has nothing to do with my rating. The food was disgusting. I had the chicken and waffle, which was simply not good.  When asked if I was enjoying my meal, I gave my honest feedback. The waitress was accommodating with replacing my meal with something else.  This time I chose French toast...playing it safe.  It was horrible...the worse French toast I've ever had.  The flavor was really bad and it was undercooked.  I had my husband taste it too and the look on his face was classic.  I can't even explain the taste other than BAD.  

Yesterday, we went to Pamela's which is around the corner.  It was delicious!!!! Considering people seem to compare the two, I thought De Luca's would be comparable.  NOT AT ALL.

I came here on a weekday for a quick after-work breakfast. I worked overnight and was starving. The place was pretty empty and we got our food quickly but it was pretty underwhelming. I got a Greek omelette that was mostly egg with one tomato slice, two leaves of spinach, and some bland chicken thrown in for good measure. I don't eat a lot of salt but had to add a ton. The salt shaker holes were crusted shut so I actually had to open it up and dump salt on the food. Next time I'll just make one at home. I would have been more disappointed if I had stood in line for hours
Stumbled on the gem while at a convention in Pittsburgh. My group wound up eating there every day of the trip. The breakfast is the best I've ever had. You have to try the Mancinis raisin bread!
came here after seeing Man v Food, and it was definitely a great place.  good hometown atmosphere with quality food. the 30 minute wait in the cold was worth it.

If you travel to Pittsburgh, you cannot leave without having Breakfast at Deluca's. This is a piece of Pittsburgh history, and the food/environment is truly wonderful! They are still running this place the way they did 50-years ago. Family run diner that is worth your time, and the small penny that it will cost for a large meal. I highly recommend going early on Saturday morning, grabbing breakfast from Deluca's and then exploring the Strip District.
My favorite breakfast location in Pittsburgh. Very friendly staff. The breakfast special which is served until 9 am is a great deal.

Love this place. Went in the morning and it was packed. Expect to wait 5 minutes or so when busy. The surprising part if your wait seemed forever, you get your food real fast!  I loved the Greek Benedict !

This is my favorite place for breakfast in Pittsburgh. You can't go wrong with their pancakes or waffles! If you're going here on the weekend, you can anticipate that the line will be out the door. They are excellent about getting you seated as quickly as possible, so don't let it intimidate you too much!

It was man v. Food that drew us to deluca's the first time, but it was the food that drew us back. We went for brunch, and the peanut butter hotcakes were the star of the show, while the rest of our party had the above average huevos rancheros and the somewhat disappointing French toast. Overall, we hope to come back soon.

There was a very long wait time on a Saturday morning. Took us like an hour before we were seated.

The Italian veggie frittata omelette tasted average. It was very greasy and lack of flavour. However, the MOAB burrito and apple cinnamon pancake were amazingly delicious.  The MOAB burrito has lots of flavours with many filling inside the soft tortilla. The apple cinnamon pancake was very fluffy and soft. 

The server was unfriendly with a poor attitude and she took a long time to re-fills the coffee.

Overall, I think this place is over hyped. But we did enjoy the food except for their poor service level.
Came on a Friday around 1130, not too long of a wait. Our server was very nice and the food was good! No complaints from anyone in my group. I'd love to try the pancake sundaes next time!!

Surprised they didn't open earlier in a Sunday but it was worth the wait to get in. 

Always want to try something new but couldn't pass up on the eggs Benedict.  The sauce is consistently the same and the Mancini bread has something to do with the experience I think. 

Sometimes the eggs get overdone but one of the most consistent places for Benedict.
Great food! Really good coffee. For the price you get an incredible amount of food. I wish I was in town longer to go again.
Greasy spoon is defined by a trip to Deluca's After several visits i realized I needed to be hungover to enjoy it. Sorry, but the P&G diner around the corner puts it to shame.

At first glance, it looks like any other typical grungy little diner.  Until you try the food - absolute heaven.

Had the cinnamon french toast with scrambled eggs - the french toast was hot and chewy and sweet, but the eggs... OMG, the eggs.   Best I've ever had.  Seems silly, but very few know how to make them well.

All the dishes looked great - smelled yummy and were HUGE.

Long wait in line, and cash only - but definitely will be back

While the severs themselves have gotten noticeably better, the kitchen staff is still lacking. On 2 different occasions my MOAB breakfast burrito has been served without meat. The meals have been coming out cold and staggered, whereas some of your party will be half way done before everyone gets their food.

Having been raised in Pittsburgh, I went to this establishment for breakfast with my father. There were flies everywhere (I actually swatted one with my menu).  Two flies were mating on our table... After a very long wait, I picked up my fork, which was covered in crusted food remnants, which lead me to a request for another.  Then, I cut into my scrambled eggs to find a plastic liner from a new ketchup bottle inside of my eggs!!!  I pushed the food to the side and watched as my father ate his food.  I will never be back.

Waited 30 mins for a table, which is apparently normal, was seated in a booth. Ordered the danish cakes with lingonberry preserves, companion had cinnamon bun pancakes with a side of eggs for both. Total cost including tax + tip was around $20. Great place, fun decorations/pictures!
I used to think Pamela's was the best breakfast in town, until I came to this place.  Amazing.

Nothing special at all!!!
 When my husband and I walked in, the waitress was serving coffee to a customer. .she shouted, " be with you guys in a minute"  she then gave us 2 menus and pointed and said, " sit at that table"     What hell?!!!
Crazy rude and loud! I also saw a server at the register handling money and then go prep toast without washing her hands!  Yuk

After years of living in Pittsburgh I finally came here with a camp-anion before she left town as she had never eaten here either.  We showed up to the door and we waited, and waited.... and waited.

The line was out the door and up the sidewalk, mostly people out of town.

We finally get in and to be honest I was ready for a let down another over hyped place that relied on its name rather than its food.  Thankfully I was wrong!

Menu is quite large there are alot of breakfast staples and some new twists on classics so there is something for everyone.  People are packed in a bit tight but I guess it beats waiting in line longer.

I got a eggs bacon and pancakes and my companion got the California omelette and a milkshake.  Food came out pretty quick and was really good and the portions were generous.  

Definitely lived up to the hype and was high quality diner food.

Only let down was it being cash only.  I know its Pittsburgh and some places that still dont accept credit cards but for a place that is pretty centrally located and has people flock to from out of town I think they need to get with the times and fork over that 2% to the credit card companies.
Nice little greasy spoon with a line of people waiting to be seated. French Toast and Eggs Benedict were good, as were the potatoes. But bring cash since they don't take debit/credit cards.

Love the pumpkin pancakes here! They are the best pancakes I ever had. My husband got the breakfast burrito and raved about it. There is a bit of a wait because it's so popular, but this place is a classic and not to be missed!!!

Had the Italian Veggie, Border of South omelette, and Mediterranean Wrap. 

Sorry, in conclusion, I won't be back. 
Food was OK, the South omelette was pretty good, but not  something to wait for over 30 min after ordering and pay $10 each. I was so embarrassed taking my parents who were visiting me from a country over 6500 miles away.

Place was packed but didn't have a long waiting line outside on a Sunday 8AM right before Memorial Day.
The couple seated after us were half done with their meal when we asked what happened to our order, and not even a "thanks for waiting" or "sorry to keep you waiting" look? And no bag to put the box in for left overs when another table gets one? Not a kind of service I would go back for.

Giving two stars simply for the one good omelette. If not, one star for this business.

Really enjoyed our trip to Steeler town and eating at this diner.   Don't expect to lose weight after this outing but that goes without saying when you visit a diner.  Try the seafood eggs benedict or any of the other items as I do not think you will be unhappy.  Another nice aspect of eating here is the ability to burn some of the calories you consumed by visiting the many shops and businesses nearby- they go on for blocks

Vibe:  It is a diner!  Check out the pics on Yelp
Service:  No complaints- cooked as requested
Food:  Not gourmet, but very good!

Had sea food omelette and it was really good. Portion size was humongous. All of us loved it. Probably not the healthiest thing to eat but if you are in a mood to just go hog.. this is the place to go.

Older diner in the Strip District. Pretty busy on Sunday (game day), prepare to wait a while. Food was good, service was good. I had Steel City Breakfast of Champs, plenty of food for most. Bacon had a great smokey flavor to it! Try the fried chicken with the breakfast.

Stopped in this morning waiting for Ikea to open. There was a very short wait and we were seated very quickly.

I had the seafood omelet with egg white, home fries and wheat toast. The omelet was packed full with seafood and topped with fresh slices of avocado. Very tasty.

I would definitely return to this location.

I'm not saying Delucas is McCormick & Schmick's.  I'm just saying if you want a great diner breakfast without the frills you will not do any better than Delucas.  Somehow, every time we head back to the 'burgh to visit, we end up having breakfast here.  There's a reason for that long line down the sidewalk on Saturday mornings.  (Don't worry the line moves fast and it is worth waiting for.)  What am I doing here?  Wait.  Can I change my review and say the place stinks?  That way I can keep it all to myself  (-:   

(Too late.)

Awwww yeah, the best breakfast burrito on the planet.  The rest of the breakfast is great and all, but this badboy literally weighs in at about 2 pounds of bacon, eggs, hashbrowns, cheese, sausage, and onions.  It's all topped off with cheapo enchelada sauce from a can, adding to the white trash ambiance.  It's remarkable.

Awesome food. 

I mean....awesome. 

I would totally give this place five stars, but ...
a.) I had to wait in line outside in the freezing cold for an hour to even get a table. 
b.) the service was pretty terrible

I would normally take off two stars for that, but the food was THAT good. 

I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and Lobster Bisque Soup. mmmm.

One of the best breakfast joints in Pittsburgh is now open in Robinson (across the street from IKEA). Awesome service,  incredible food and huge portions round out my favorite new breakfast spot. Pancakes are massive and HOMEMADE (not a store bought mix, like most places). Bacon is nice and crispy and is great on your breakfast plate or your BLT! The huge menu can't be beat, so if you can't find something to fit your fancy here... check your pulse. Huge thumbs up!

Lucky find of the week.  We stumbled onto this gem just by fate.  We were hungry and did not know where to go, so we followed a couple of kids into this place and I am sure glad we did.  There was no line or wait we got in and out increadibly quick.  The server was very nice and the Breakfast Burrito had this delicious sause covering it.   My girl got an omlette with fetta cheese and spinach.  We watched the cook make it using fresh spinach and fetta.
One of my favorite places to eat breakfast, hearty portions and just plain good food. Their omelettes are huge and delicious, been there over a dozen times haven't had a less than great meal yet!

My fianc√© and I loved the food and the service. It it definitely a great place to go if your an out of towner and what to get a feel for the Pittsburgh culture. They give you more than your money's worth. The pancakes are delicious.

Do you like hot garbage and rude service? If you do then come here to eat. Food is not cooked properly. If you ask for anything cooked more, they become very upset.  I have never had such a bad experience. If I were to describe it in one
 word it would be DISGUSTING!!

Deluca's isn't a IHOP you pull up park and stroll in. The Strip District has parking, but you'll pay to park and walk to get to Deluca's. I saw people standing in line waiting to eat while jackhammers were chipping up the sidewalk a few feet away. That kind of devotion says it all!

The food was good, the service was great. The food isn't greasy or nasty. The menu choices are unique. I would eat there again. I would recommend eating there on weekdays to avoid the crowds. 

Pittsburgh's Strip District has some great places to shop and wonderful foods to purchase. I can't wait to go back.

I had high hopes for this popular breakfast spot.  While the long line did move fast, you feel pressured to get in and out and therefore are not able to relax and chat with your party after finishing your meal.  Portions are way too big.  Food is not bad, but not good.  I would not go here again by choice.

Deluca's is your typical hole-in-the-wall.  It can get a tad smoky, not the cleanest, the line is always long- out the door and down the sidewalk, and I've never personally had the greatest service BUT they do deliver when it comes to the food.  We always leave satisfied and have yet to be disappointed!

Love the mixed grill along with a side of pancakes......

I came here for a Saturday brunch. The line wasn't too long, but we still waited for about 20 minutes. 

The menu is huge, so it was hard for me decide what to get. I ordered South Of The Border while my friend had french toast with scrambled eggs and bacon. The black tea and lemon he had was good, though it was probably because I never had tried them together before. His toast was good, but he wasn't so happy with the food overall.  Not because they're bad, but you expect getting better food than what you can cook at home. I was happy with my omelette and their home fries. The chorizo really spiced it up. I don't like the salsa or ketchup on it though. 

The service was quick once we were seated. It took a while to get our food. Would I come back again? Yes if I don't need to wait.

Awesome diner experience! The line was out the door, so I expected a great meal. We waited about 15 min on a Saturday morning before we were seated at the counter. We received coffee and water quickly. The coffee was good and our cups were full the entire meal, thanks to great service. 

I got the mixed plate with poached eggs. Definitely lived up to its hype on Man vs Food. Perfectly grilled veggies, crispy potatoes and the runny yolk. Each bite was great. Definitely filled me up! Also had a few bites of hubby's French toast. It was soooo good! Thick, custardy and chewy. Loved it! 
 
We had a great Pittsburgh experience here!

I've gone to Deluca's multiple times in the past few years and every time it's delicious! There are an extensive number of breakfast options that are really great, depending on what you are in the mood for. They have stacks of specialty pancakes with extravagant toppings and tons of other, more savory options. Watch out and plan early to come, cause the line is always out the door!
Been there several times and I keep going back. They have a great selection of breakfast entrees and they are all good. Wait in the line that extends outside it is well worth it.

We brought in friend's from out of town after talking about how wonderful this place was....never again will we come. We are still sitting here an hour later and have had to request...TEN...yes TEN forgotten ordered items at least three times. As we were paying our bill our waitress, Mary, brought over the eggs and bacon that she already charged us for...:-(

Our server was incredibly attentive and polite. I accidentally ordered eggs that had ham in them (  vegetarian) and our server traded it out at no charge. My dining partner and I assured him that we would pay for the extra dish because it was our mistake--and said dining partner even ATE the offending eggs to prove it. Still, no charge. We left a sizeable tip to compensate the place, which was our meager compromise with ourselves. 

Still, the food was only so-so. My omelet was overly greasy, as were the potatoes. Great service, fun atmosphere, but my experience with the actual food was nothing spectacular.

Ten stars (if I could). I was surprised by the line at the door, but super curious to see what the fuss was all about! I had the waffle combo, and ordered a side of peanut butter (as I always do). Our server, Kim, was unbelievably helpful and personable...even surprising me by bringing lingonberry for me to try with my waffle (so good!). DELICIOUS COFFEE!! 10/10 would come here again- even on a game day. Worth the wait! Yumm.

This will be the last time we visit.   The service was slow and not welcoming.  It took too long for us to order and even refill our coffee.  Waitresses had attitudes that you can see with each other just sitting at the bench area. Totally dis functional.   Once the food finally came, we had burnt but yet undercooked potatoes and burnt with undercooked bacon.   How is that possible ? Not evenly cooked at all!!!  While watching the waitresses, they would take orders touch everything then go and put bread on the toaster!! No hand washing!!!!  Needless to say we didn't eat our toast once arrived.  Once we are done it took 5 mins standings at the register for someone to check us out since they seem to not help each other.   Sorry delucas but we will not be back. For 30 dollar breakfast I expected a lot more.

Who complains when they have a belly full of Deluca's Pancakes??
This place rocks!! 
On a recent trip back east, I was able to try this restaurant. We love trying and going to small diners that provide great food, large portions and a manageable prices.
I had the warm apple pancakes....OMG....so so good.
Try anything on the menu.....its all good!!
Def new fav in the Strip District!

I really did not get what all the hype was about.  The food is ok.  I had eggs, sausage home fries it was fair nothing spectacular.  

The inside looks like it has been cared for since the place opened.

Visiting Pittsburgh and came across this gem. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day and I am hard to plead. But this was the best breakfast that I have ever had. Whenever I come in town for a game, I will enjoy breakfast here.

Deluca's is becoming a regular haunt for us.  Why? you ask.  Well because the food is amazing!!! Huge sevings.  Friendly service.  My only pet peeve, and the reason for 4 stars, is I have yet to have an entire order come to the table at the same time.  It's always staggered and someone (whether a party of 2 or 5) has to wait for their food.

But the food is so worth the wait!!!!

Awesome food, great environment for a weekend breakfast diner. Service is good, with friendly people.  Every item on this menu is fantastic.  I love their breakfast burrito, they have a great Western omelette, chocolate chip pancakes are light and fluffy topped with powder sugar, some loose chocolate chips, and just the right amount of chocolate melted inside that theyre not too sweet, but syrup unnecessary.  They have great coffee, which for coffee snobs like me and my girlfriend, a good breakfast place has to have.  We have been down to the one in the Pittsburgh's Strip District which is the original, however with the seating a little small, and the line usually wrapping down the sidewalk on weekends, we decided to try the Robinson one which is located in the Robinson Town Centre in the Plaza across from the IKEA and next to the IKEA pickup center.  This location seems to be setup better seating wise, and with the added ability to check -in and then wait in your car or the benches they have out front, much more comfortable than the strip district location. If you're headed out to the Robinson Town Centre to do some shopping and find yourself looking for a place to have breakfast, forget IHOP or Eat'nPark check out DeLucas!

I had a breakfast burrito here. 

It hit my stomach like a bomb.

Avoid the breakfast burrito.

Regardless, I really loved the ambiance here. It's greasy, it feels like it's 1972 and the servers are awesome.

The pancakes, oh sweet calorie-laden goodness! Probably the best I've had in my life - and this is not an overstatement. We had a lunch plate (turkey triple decker) and a breakfast plate (short stack special). Both were excellent. This place is cash only and can have a line, but walked up at 1:45 and there was no line (there had been a good line at noon). The other reviews said the wait was worth it and though I didn't wait, I completely agree. If you're in the strip, eat here.
Eaten there several times. Always excellent service and food. Clean bathrooms.  Priced right, more food than I can eat.

This place is a very good choice for breakfast. The food was delicious and very filling. As far as I could tell the service was ok but it was memorial weekend during the middle of a large race with a very large group of people. In conclusion, this restaurant is a very good choice for a family breakfast.

Well... this is the famous Deluca' s with big portions and old school 50's diner feel. They're right. Very old and run down but the service is good and the food is too. Large portions and huge menu selections. Cash only so if you're using cards on your trip and you want to come to Deluca 's get cash.

Used to be regulars.  Decided to try again yesterday and the place has gone down hill.  They would not accommodate a special menu request to sub turkey sausage for hot sausage.  Also potatoes came out burned to a crisp.  Not even edible.  Won't be going back there any time soon.  Guess I'll have to find the "best breakfast in the burgh" elsewhere.

We usually love this place, been to Deluca's four times.  But the service today was terrible.  Our waitress took forever to take our order, and then in the middle of taking it, she left to go deliver other customers food.  Took her 10 minutes to get back to us to finish taking our order.  In the meantime, all of our drinks were empty and she didn't even notice.  We had to ask for refills.   All in all, even though the food is good, we may never be coming back.  The service is just unacceptable.

Honestly I don't understand where these great reviews are coming from. This restaurant is filthy, our food was dripping in grease (how can a turkey sandwich be greasy?) and I found a hair in my salad. We got lunch food so maybe the breakfast food is better but it can't make up for the filth!
So far the best breakfast place in Pittsburgh! Try their egg Benedict

I was told you must visit Deluca's, we had to do take out because of the long line and and time constraints. I had the blast blt with the Cajun fries. I was not disappointed, very good food! Can't say to much else because of doing take out, but just from seeing the line to get in, plan accordingly.

The staff is nice but the food doesn't match the price. I had the veggie burrito and the people with me had another of their breakfast burritos and pancakes. None of us really enjoyed our food. The door signs say it's the best breakfast, but I would give this place a pass and check out Pamela's or Coca Cafe for the best breakfast in Pittsburgh

Went for breakfast and wasn't impressed at all.  The people who work at DeLucas are not friendly and have a you should be happy I am serving you attitude.  If you are not a morning person then you shouldn't serve breakfast.  A smile and a good morning goes a long way.

The food was mediocre, greasy and lacking flavor. I ordered the California Omelette and it was something I could make at home with better flavor.  The chicken in the omelette had no taste and it was overlooked.

Overall, I don't get the hype.  This is similar to a greasy diner.  Pamela's is the place for breakfast.

The food was pretty good for a diner, but definitely not worth the wait... the service was terrible (somewhat rude, but more disorganized than anything)

After waiting in line for 40 minutes, we sat down and were told that the cook needed to catch up on orders... 30 minutes later we saw a waitress behind the counter taking orders from people who just sat down. when we asked if we could place our orders, we got a pretty rude/sassy lecture along the lines of  "didnt we already tell you that the cook was catching up on orders"  *(yeah, you told us that THIRTY MINUTES AGO... for real...how longs it take to make eggs?)..  when we pointed out that people that just sat down were having orders taken, our waitress asked the cooks and apparently it was ok.... after 30 additional minutes... average pancakes and eggs came out.

again... 1 hour and 40 minutes for so-so pancakes/eggs with a side rude waiters that had no idea what they were doing. 

Save yourself a few hours and go to Ritters

I am committed to my all or nothing reviews so unfortunately Deluca's gets the short end of the stick because if they were in a different neighborhood they may have gotten 5 stars, but not in the strip.  I liked Deluca's food and selection, but their booths are the most uncomfortable seating I have had in years.  Deluca's is one block away from Pamela's in the strip.  Comparing the two: Pamela's food is better, their prices are lower and the seating is much more comfortable, Deluca's menu is larger, both have long waits on weekends.  If you are in the strip, there is no reason to go to Deluca's, go to Pamela's.

I went with the egg, cheese, and ham sandwhich with the lobster bisque soup. Since it was early afternoon I wanted more of the brunch feel. The sandwhich bread was well buttered but small compared to the large portion of egg, ham and cheese. The ham slab was overwelming so I removed at least half. Next time I will stick with just the egg and cheese sandwhich. 
Cash only policy was a totally let down but the prices were good since its a dinner.

Filling, fried breakfasts don't get any better than Deluca's. I was tempted to go here by the Pittsburgh episode of Man v. Food. My wife, her friend, and I got there early, around 8:00 on a Saturday morning, which was a bit painful on the weekend, but I am very glad we came when we did. Although we were seated immediately upon our arrival, by the time we left, an hour later, the line to get in was half way around the block!  Our waitress was extremely friendly, which was reassuring, because I think that waitstaff in popular, crowded establishments can be off-putting at times. However, ours was prompt and helpful. The coffee and water refills kept on coming.

I ordered the grilled vegetable platter with chorizo, which was absolutely humongous! The chorizo was in patty form, nicely browned, and just a bit spicy. I got some hot sauce and poured it on. The vegetables were amazingly not greasy, but steamed on the griddle. It was mostly onions and peppers, as far as I can recall. I thought, "My God. This is ridiculous." However, a few minutes later, I had thoroughly disgusted myself by eating 
the entire thing! I may have loosened by belt by the time I was done.

My recommendation: Go early. Go big. There is a "healthy options" portion in the very extensive menu, but why do this to yourself? It would be like ordering a hot dog in a seafood restaurant. This is Deluca's. It's busy, legendary, and unique. Live it up!

Got a breakfast burrito. It was one of the better breakfast burritos I've had but the sauce that they put on it was disgusting. The menu called it Spanish style but it was more like watered down ketchup. Next time I'm definitely asking them to hold the sauce. Service was quick although I wouldn't necessarily call my waitress friendly. She was a bit snippy and seemed angry that we needed more time to look at the menu. We were there on a weekday morning and the place was fairly empty so I'm not sure why she was upset that we weren't ready to order the second we sat down. The woman who cashed us out when we went up to pay was nice and gave us a coupon for $1 off our next visit when I donated to the charity bucket at the register. Good food, adequate if slightly surly service, plenty of options for brunch? We'll be back someday. Not good enough to be worth fighting weekend crowds bit this might be our new weekday breakfast place.

Great spot!  If you're thinking big,greasy breakfast...this hits the nail on the head.  Get there early otherwise expect to line up outside.  Service was good, food was awesome.

Try the MOAB for something different, the egg, chili, hash brown, avocado, banana peppers, onions make a great combination of flavor.  2.5lbs of tasty goodness.

Next time in Pittsburgh will definitely be back!

Recently visited a friend in pittsburgh and she decided to bring me here. We got there around 1 on a Sunday afternoon aka Peak brunch time. So we had to wait in line for a little bit but wasnt more than 10 minutes. When you walk in they have a sign  stating "best breakfast in town' and yeaa it prob is. 

the food- yumm. I ordered an egg white veggie and cheese omelette. Came with a side of toast and homefries. And a banana choc chip pancake. Soo good. I'm not a fan of homefries but I Finished everything else all by myself haha. 
My friends ordered pancakes, scrambled eggs, homefries and loved their food as well! Plus can't complain about the unlimited coffee. 

Portions are big, service is good, and food is yumm. If i were in pittsburgh again, I'd def go back!

Amazing!   We were a party of two. Probably could've been seated sooner as no one seemed to want to sit at the counter in the back, (definitely check with host to see if available).  We loved it as we could watch the cooks in action!  I had the seafood omelette with hollandaise and avocado on top, ask for it without the roasted red pepper.  My waiter came up with the recipe, minus the pepper.  They added it for some reason, but I feel took away from the taste sensation.  Had the Italian toast and ordered a side of the lingonberry preserves to share.  It was incredible!!!  Highly recommend this fun experience!

The best place to get breakfast in Pittsburgh! Food is always nice and hot and made to order. The only accept cash payments no cards. They are extremely busy on weekends so if you do go then prepare to wait.

Unfortunately I cannot even comment on the food since I never got to see the menu or sit at a table. The front service was HORRIBLE. Slow, slow, slow. At least 5 families were waiting with 3 tables cleared. And when I say cleared, I mean wiped down with the same rag without being washed out. Everyone waiting was complaining about the wait and incompetence of the two people taking names and cleaning the tables. If you are looking for a diner experience that has some pep in their step to seat you, this is not the place to go.

This was my first visit. I've always heard amazing things about Deluca's, so we were excited to dine there. After my friend ordered a coffee, we noticed that they kept the dairy creamer on the table. In fact, they were on all the tables. Although this was unsanitary, I could honestly look past it if they're being changed often. Well, when he opened the container, we noticed mold on the inside of it. When my friend asked our server, Jess, for more cream, she took it, filled up the SAME container & brought it back. She clearly didn't pay attention to it.

Our server, Jess, was not personable and barely stuck around to see if we had everything we needed. They really weren't busy, this was post lunch rush. I ordered a breakfast meal... Jess brought our food and my pancakes were still going to take a minute, which is absolutely fine. However, I watched my pancakes come up in the window and sit there for 8-10 min while Jess sat at a table and talked to 2 men. She even went back to the window while the pancakes were sitting there and ran other food. She totally forgot about them. When she finally did bring them to the table, they were luke warm. Needless to say, I was very unsatisfied. The rest of the food was decent, though.

What Jess didn't realize is that she was waiting on 2 people in the food industry (my friend is a manager & I'm a server). I could have forgiven all of the mishaps if I felt like Jess honestly cared about our visit. No one is perfect & mistakes happen, but she showed no remorse and consideration for us. I will not be returning to this location.

I've been to Delucas a couple times before and it's always been good. I tried going this morning and was seated by an unwelcoming host/server. A guy came over and asked what we would like for drink. When he brought the drinks, he just sat them down and walked away.. No straws! (I can't stand that.) After waiting 10 minutes for him to come back, we just left. Not sure what the hype about this place is.

While my mixed grill was OK, it was nothing I couldn't make at home.  I was expecting bigger flavor.  
The 2 stars come from the HORRIBLE service.  I get it - greasy spoon, yinzers, etc.  But c'mon....45 minutes to make some eggs?  the dumb waitress said "they're a little backed up".  Well, yeah, but c'mon.  We were there WAY too long.  It kind of ruined the rest of our day. 

This isn't the best breakfast in PGH by any stretch of the imagination.  It was fine for what it was, but the terrible service = not returning.  I have better things to do during my trips to Pittsburgh then wait around for breakfast.

Deluca's dinner had great food at least for my non vegetarian friends... They didn't have a great vegetarian selection but they had some great and really soft pancakes ... The quantity was massive and I wasn't able to finish... The building had a nice ambience and an old restaurant vibe and the waiters are really polite and helpful..( In case you can't finish they'll give you a box so you can take the food back home )..
Service was slow and there was a long wait because it was a Sunday. The food was outstanding. There was a fantastic selection and I had Greek Eggs Benedict which were incredible.

Why is this only a 3?  This place is a gem. You are greeted like family and the staff is fun to watch. The choices are fantabulous, the portions will require a nap afterwards. If you are hungry, they have 6 egg omelettes...4 egg is the NORM. Hand cut steaks. 
Making my choice was the hardest time. Your coffee/water never empty. 

Glad I tried this local venue. Home run

This place is what you call a legendary spot! The line was out the door and around the corner when we arrived. I never seen a place with a line that long in my city. It was worth every second of the wait! The  omelettes are packed with flavor and a generous amount of toppings! Loved every bite love the service and the entire atmosphere!

Nice food but really oversold.  It has everything you can try but really not up to the par everyone raves about.  I'm vegetarian so options might be limited but not that impressed.  Home fries are good but really unhygienic when you see these guys making it.  No reservations so have to stand outside.
The waitresses were more interested in talking to each other than waiting on tables. Once they took our order the food came fast and was good.

I understand that sometimes when a restaurant becomes an establishment, it's more about the experience than the food. But I still don't see why Deluca's is so popular. I got a breakfast burrito that was filling but pretty underwhelming and a sauce that was too sweet for my tastes. The rest of my party had things like corned beef hash and pancakes that didn't stand out from any number of other diners I've been to. If I had their meals I might go with three stars, but even then I would expect more for the popularity.

Stopped by with our children our waitress I believe her name was Jamie, regardless the blond short waitress. What a disaster had to continuously send our food back because of it being wrong, when we told JAMIE we got nothing but eye rolls,arguments, and attitude. Last I checked I am the customer and could care less about your petty excuses for my order being wrong. If JAMIE would ha e handled the situation better than maybe I would have considered giving you another shot. Not to mention everytime JAMIE walked away from our table she muttered bitch, cunt, asshole etc. To any waitress that would listen as they stared us down and she slammed plates around. The way JAMIE acted was horrendous not only in a business environment but in front of our children nonetheless. DISPICABLE

Great breakfast food! Good coffee. Service is quick and the breakfast/lunch food is SO MUCH BETTER than Pamela's. 

The location is perfect so that you can go grocery shopping afterwards (in the Strip District).

My family and I couldn't decide where to have breakfast while shopping in the strip. It was between here and Pamela's, and I'm glad we tried Deluca's.

There's almost always a line out the door. We did have to wait a while, but it didn't seem long at all. I ordered an ordinary breakfast with over medium eggs, bacon, and toast. It was good and satisfied my appetite. My mom ordered the mixed grill. It's not the most pretty thing, but it sure is yummy. My aunt, however, ordered their cinnamon French toast, and I had to try a few bites. It was delicious. That's for sure what I'm going to order the next time I'm there.

The only thing that sort of bothered me is how packed the restaurant gets, and I was feeling a bit claustrophobic. That's not such a big deal when their food is good though, and I forgot all about it when I was eating. I also hardly saw anyone on staff smile other than the cooks who seem to be the only people who were happy.

All in all, its a great breakfast and lunch spot. While the experience didn't wow me, there's plenty of items on the menu for everyone to find something they'll enjoy.

Great dinner and excellent food quality.  Went at 12 and had zero wait.  Staff was friendly and moved quickly.  Quick, delicious and large.  Value for the dollar was great. Remember to bring cash, no credit cards.
Great breakfast with the family. Busy but we got a seat for 8 in about 15 minutes. Wish they had some black t-shirts!

Best diner I've ever been to. Visited with my aunt who moved away about from Pittsburgh about twenty years ago. She said it is still just as good as she remembers. Real, authentic experience with awesome food that doesn't cost an arm and a leg. One thing is it is CASH ONLY! Not a big problem, but can catch you off guard if you're not a regular. Great staff and great experience. Hopefully I can come back soon!
Best Breakfast in the 'burgh! Quick service even with a wait.

I've been wanting to try Deluca's for such a long time. The first time I wanted to go there there was quite a few people waiting in front of us, so we decided to try it another day. I went just this past Friday....and I absolutely love it there!! We didn't have to wait at all at the time we went around 11..I was so surprised it wasn't busier, but I think it just all depends on the times and day it is. First off, I do want to mention the staff is not very friendly at all there! They almost seemed bothered that there are people eating at this place. That's the only negative thing I have to say. The atmosphere is cute, typical diner, I love how it looks like an old fashioned diner. We sat at the booth where Tom Cruise sat at during a scene filmed at Deluca's for Jack Reacher. I think that adds a cool touch to the place! Their menu has to be the biggest menu I have ever seen! There are so many options, it's a little overwhelming to be honest. They don't just have breakfast items, they have lunch and dessert items. There food is absolutely delicious!! I can not wait to go back!

After sitting at the table the hostess directed us to, we got up after 10 minutes of no menus or anyone acknowledging us. Oh, but the hostess did come over to see if there was money on the table after the last group left. She even had the gall to say "Have a good day" as we left. Won't be back to DeLucas. Luckily, Pamela's is around the corner.

I think I died and went to heaven here. I went for breakfast after a night of drinking (it was Friday, so the wait wasn't very long). And omg, the eggs benedict I got was some of the best I have ever had. I am getting hungry right now just thinking about it. They put it on some sort of French bread instead of a biscuit, and it didn't get soggy fast, which made all the difference. The avocado on it was fresh on the eggs - and the sauce on top was perfect. Our waitress was also super helpful and nice. She did a fantastic job. The only downside is that they are cash only. Oh well - small price to pay for being so delicious! I can't wait until I am in the city again to eat there.

This place is sort of a local legend, and rightly so, as any place that serves ice cream as a breakfast food (on waffles!) is a place you should go to at least once. Having said that--We just went again and the service was terrible. It was a slow day, and there were a ton of staff on, and we still waited 10-15 minutes to have our order taken. My food didn't come as described in the menu, and the mashed potatoes came in a gigantic flavorless mound. If you want a ton of mediocre food, in a fun, old-school diner atmosphere, this is your spot. If you want something truly delicious, look elsewhere.

I had no idea what to expect when I did a Yelp search, but I was pleasantly surprised by this local establishment.   The menu was huge and the prices were super reasonable.   I went on a saturday morning, so it was insane, but well worth the wait.   Just what I was looking for - except next time I'll come earlier so I don't have to wait in the freezing cold.

This place is one of the best whole in the wall breakfast spots i've been to, ever, I put down the chocolate chip ice cream pancakes and the vegetable egg chorizo scramble combo buisness (forget the exact name)...the waitress stopped me half way through ordering and disclaimered how much food that would be, I said i know, and yes i did finish it all :)

I got the French toast and my brother got the Philly cheesesteak. With all due respect for the reputation and the long waiting line in front of this place (that made me curious to give this place a try), i must say the food was nothing impressive. They should find a way to deal with the smoke from the kitchen. My glasses got so foggy the moment i stepped inside this place. My coat smells like steak for hours afterward. The only good thing is the service. People are friendly there. Also, they only take cash.

Took a quick trip to Pittsburgh with the wife and kids, before we went to Pittsburgh we planned on stopping at a popular restaurant or diner. We went online to see if any food Network shows had been to the area. It just happens that Delucas had been featured on man VS food. We stopped in to check it out. It's a very family friendly place. The hostess and waitresses were older, which was very welcoming. The interior definitely has an older look to it which is refreshing. And the kitchen is open to watch.

But about the food, we ordered our sons cheeseburger sliders and their chicken fingers. Now these chicken fingers were HUGE. Full hand breaded cutlets and they were pretty tasty. My wife also ordered a chicken finger basket. But for me I still desired breakfast so I ordered the M.O.A.B. (Mother of all burritos) my goodness this thing was mammoth. Chorizo, eggs, potatoes, cheese and more cheese with banana peppers stuffed in a flour tortilla. I gotta say it was pretty good, I didn't finish it, and with good reason. This thing is huge. But the potatoes inside were amazing. The eggs were fluffy and my goodness the chorizo. If anyone is ever in the Pittsburgh area, please stop here. You won't regret it.

I had brunch there, I went for the ham steak! It was okay, nothing special.
I guess the characteristic of the place is huge plates, which is not really my type, but if some one wants to pay 13$ and eat like 3 people's breakfast, this place is a good one! 

One thing I don't like was I asked for substitute for my home fries to fruit cup, but they brought me both and charge me for both! The lady was so nice, so I did not say anything! We were +5 so we were able to reserve the place, otherwise there is a long long long line for it!
Great space with fun decor friendly staff and  interesting menu.  Will return next time I'm in the area.

Nothing fancy here. Looks like a tiny, run-down kitchen, but the long line of people waiting outside in the cold weather sort of makes you curious.

This breakfast joint serves delicious pancakes & the incredibly attentive waitstaff (despite the chaotic morning hours) kept re-filling my coffee mug without even having to be asked. They serve big portions and it is definitely not the place to go if you are diet-conscious. Otherwise, go here if you want a hearty yet inexpensive breakfast. This is not your regular IHOP.

Great customer service! I got the Hotcake Special with hot sausage and bacon on the side. I always order my eggs runny soft and usually they come out scrambled to hard, but here the cool made them perfectly which is rare! 
This place really has that homey small town diner look that makes you feel at home. Whenever I come back to Pittsburgh, I plan on indulging in a good breakfast around the lovely people of Pittsburgh!

This is the best greasy spoon you can find and it is awesome.  I had the veggie mix grill.  The prices are perfect the atmosphere is classic dinner / hole in the wall / grandmas kitchen and it is packed every inch full of hungry customers.  One of the best breakfast places in town.  Get there early and I mean early the line may be down the street but the wait is worth it.

This place is crazy good. We had to wait around 20 minutes to get in (the line goes out the door and down the street when it's busy), but the move people through pretty quickly. Their pancakes are so good. I had the Apple Pie pancakes that came with whip cream and ice cream. Oh my gosh sooooooo amazing! Really rich and super filling, but somehow I managed. I loved that place!

Man versus food. Food won on my visit!

Had the Breakfast of Champions. My eyes nearly popped out of my head when it came out on Not 1 or 2, but 3 PLATES!

Food: Lot of carbs that fill you up quickly - toast, pancake, hash, eggs. Bacon was crispy but flavorful and definitely enjoyed that. Love the chocolate chip pancake where they add them into the pancake instead of just pouring some chips on top after the pancake is done. Toast was bland - if deciding what to skip in carbs, this would be it. Hash and eggs were basic cooked items without much flavor so add your own condiments to make it work.

Service: Ok, don't come here for service cuz you'll hate yourself. Similar to other popular breakfast places I've visited, you only see servers for beverage order, food order, food delivery, check.

FYI: Cash Only! Get here before 10am on weekends to limit wait times cuz there will definitely be a line. I got here at 9am and there was about 5 min wait.

Food, and lots of it. The best breakfast in Pittsburgh ! Great service and very busy. If you want to lose weight and you like to eat, don't go here. The platter of food I ordered arrived quickly and hot. The corned beef hash is crispy on the outside and warm and tender on the inside. The meat and eggs were cooked to perfection and the cost is reasonable for the amount of great food you get. Other family members ordered pancakes that covered the platters, not plates. The toppings looked great, but they would not share. If you are in the City of Champions, this IS the place for breakfast !

Had breakfast here during a weekend trip for a game.
Finally got to try the Strawberry Fields heavenly hotcakes! ( I had vanilla ice cream instead of strawberry)
Ok, perfect name! Because i was definitely in breakfast Heaven!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This place is one I always make a point to visit when in the area. Coming in on the redeye from the west coast we weren't served food so the hunger level was high. I have visited on weekdays and weekends. The former is always better. Lines are short to non-existent on those day's. Weekends always has lines out the door that provides wait times of up to 30 minutes. On this Tuesday morning I walked right in and was seated straight away. Drinks were quickly served; no coffee for me but some of the orange juice. It was good but I prefer fresh squeezed. So I decided on a short stack of buttermilk pancakes, 2 eggs and some bacon. Everything was tasty, as always and served quickly. The service was great and everyone was super friendly. I have visited a handful of times in each of my prior visits and will make it a point to continue that tradition as long as they are around when I am in the 'burgh. Prices are always fair and comparable to fast-food and chain style restaurants. Parking is on the street and can be limited, especially on the weekends.

Although not from the Burgh, my cousins brought me to my inaugural visit at DeLuca's  years  ago  (before Man vs Food showed up).  Sleezy diners with delicious breakfast & lunch have a special place in my heart.  DeLucas nailed it for me.  From omelettes to sandwiches & salads, the food was always consistently good.  

After a 7 year hiatus, I visited P'burgh last weekend and had to hit up DeLuca's.  Seemed like something had slipped during that time period.  It took 15 minutes for the servers to decide which one of them was going to be assigned to us.  Not a good beginning.  No one even  offered coffee or a beverage to start.  

My omelette was dry and overcooked.  Veggie and meat filling wasn't warm, cheese not melted.  Soggy hash browns and barely toasted bread only added insult to injury.  Bear in mind, I'm not expecting an uber-brunch here.....its a diner, OK?   Maybe an off day, maybe not. I were  Adam Richman, Anthony Bourdain or Guy Fieri , my sorry excuse for an omelette with cold filling would have never hit the table!   (Just sayin')  Next time I'm in town, I might brave the lines at  P&G's Pamela's Diner.

A Strip institution!  Try the specialty pancakes and you won't be sorry.  If you go on a weekend, be prepared to stand in line (even in the winter) for a while.  The best times to visit DeLuca's is during the week to avoid the tourists.

If this is the best breakfast Pittsburgh has to offer, y'all need to get some better breakfast joints. I've been here twice and it was fine both times but nothing special. Coffee is average. Really don't understand what the fuss is about.

Contrary to Kenneth h.'s review, I would say there is great coffee. There is no expresso machine but its a cheaper dive place. I will say I've had cheaper breakfast in Bloomfield. But this place is worth the wait in line.

Descriptive phrase: Greasy-spoon Diner.

DeLuca's wins the breakfast battle between here and Pamela's in my opinion.

It's located directly on the main drag of the Strip, which earns it a nod. It actually looks and feels like an old-school diner, and you can tell not much has changed inside since it opened decades ago.

We were seated promptly around brunchtime but almost as soon we we sat there was a line behind us 30 people deep. On a Monday, mind you. Our waiter was rushed the whole time but the bus-boys walking around were helpful as well. It's loud, but in a neighborhood-feel kind of way. There are a bunch of people manning the long grill behind the counter, and they seem like they're enjoying themselves more than you'd think.

The menu is absolutely ginormous. I start with a chocolate milk ($1.79) and order the Califronia Benedict ($7.99) to follow. What a delicious mess of avocado, tomatoes, spinach, cheddar, all on top of poached eggs with hollandaise sauce. Absolutely fantastic. There was just much of the dense food that it was hard to get it all down in one sitting. It came with potatoes as well.

It's cash only, which seems to be a theme in Pittsburgh. Maybe I was just feeling nostalgic and DeLuca's reminds me a lot of Mickey's in Madison, WI, but I really enjoyed this place. I think you will too.

Try the Turkey sandwich. It is so good. The gravy is the best in town. 
You don't open this sandwich with your hands. It's a fork sandwich. 
Excellent service. 

Bring back the Italian Sandwich!!!!

If you are a fan of breakfast food, you will be a fan of Deluca's Restaurant. That is really all that needs to be said about this iconic Pittsburgh breakfast spot. If you are reading this however, I am sure you would probably like a little bit more information on what is actually happening here.

Located in the Strip District, and featured on Man v. Food, Deluca's Restaurant is the top choice for those looking for some grub to start their day off. During our visit, we arrived later in the morning and were greeted with a line that went out of the building and extended onto the cold sidewalk outside. However, the line moved very fast, and the employees did everything they could to get people in and out in the most productive way possible.

After being seated, and looking over the menu, I decided to get the Steel City breakfast, which is basically a little bit of everything on the menu. In fact, I felt a little glutenous when they brought out my three plates of food, but hey, I needed to get my foodie on. From the eggs, to the french toast, everything I ate was absolutely delicious. Greasy, and delicious. It was one of those meals that is just so delicious, that you don't even take the time to make conversation with your fellow diners because you are too busy stuffing your face.

I wish that Deluca's was here in Cincinnati. I would go to this wonderful restaurant every morning if I could. If you live in Pittsburgh, don't take this gift for granted. To do so, would be a great dishonor.

My last meal in Pittsburgh was at this place. It had a lot of reviews and some locals had told me just how great it was. I had actually gone on Sunday but saw the line was out the door so ended up going somewhere else. On a Monday at 11 am I didn't think it be so bad. My friends and I were seated quickly. There was a lot of options, I couldn't decide between the pancakes or the breakfast of champions. Went with the breakfast of champions and couldn't believe how much food it was. I imagined a short stack of pancakes would be small. It was two huge pancakes that I barely finished it. As I write this it is still my only meal of the day, still full haha. My friends loved the place and I'm so glad I saved the best for last. Please come to this place if you visit Pittsburgh or if you live in Pitt and have never visited. Oh and I think its cash only but not too sure. If you are a fan of pancakes as much as I am then this won't matter at all :)

They only take cash :( We saw the reviews and the hype and decided to come. I'm glad we went but I wouldn't be dying to come back. I got the MOAB and it was one of the less enjoyable breakfast burritos I've had with a really sweet salsa on it We also got a nutella pancake which was delicious but just about anything with nutella is delicious. If you're looking for OK food and ok service  with something for everyone for a reasonable price this is your place. Bring cash.
De Luca's is The Strip District breakfast place. I refuse to go anywhere else. Half the time, you'll be lined up outside the door, but it's heavenly.

My experience eating at this place resembles Manny T's. I only give it a 2nd star because it was open on a day when everything else was closed. The fact that some Yelpers give this restaurant 5 stars, and it has an overall rating of 4 stars, really diminishes Yelp's credibility in my mind. 'Disgusting' is a big word, but this place comes close.

Having grown up in a typical Philly neighborhood I felt right at home at Deluca's. The street and the restaurant transported me back to my childhood. The food line, the counter stools, the friendly wait staff all made the experience special. My wife and I stuck with the usual breakfast fare.  French toast, eggs and bacon, hash browns, toast and coffee. Everything fresh and familiar. Living close to Baltimore it is a pity they could not save some of the old close-in shopping areas to create a draw such as the Strip.

A must stop when shopping in the Strip District. This looks like a traditional Pittsburgh diner but once you enter you will see how amazing the menu is and will get a diner experience unlike no other.  They have dessert pancakes which are awesome but only for those with a big sweet tooth. In the fall I ordered the pumpkin pancakes which were tasty. This past visit my date ordered the apple cinnamon pancakes complete with whipped cream with caramel drizzle, ice cream and hot baked applies. It was to die for!!  I ordered the bacon, egg and cheese sandwich.  For a true breakfast sandwich I had them hold the tomatoes, lettuce and mayo.  It was on fresh baked bread from the local bread company, Manconi, with cheddar cheese, scrambled egg and tasty bacon delicious!  The service is quick and they only take cash (PNC mac machine right outside).  There is always a line around the block on weekends so expect to wait although the line does usually move quickly.

Amazing place for breakfast.  We came here on the last morning when visiting Pittsburgh.  So good!!! Everything on the menu is solid.  You really can't go wrong.  We kept hearing about this place and we even walked by it one of the days while exploring.  I'm so glad we got a chance to eat here before leaving.  If you are visiting Pittsburgh this is a must.  Check it out!

I was strolling through the Strip District and really had no intention on eating here. It had a huge line outside. Unfortunately my girlfriend was quite hungry and the line cleared out shortly there after so we decided to stop in.

If you love a greasy breakfast, this might just be the place to go. The portion sizes are pretty decent, I had a 6 egg omelet with a lot of meat in it. It tasted good enough, and filled me up. Like most diner food, I felt pretty queasy later on in the day from all of the grease. 

There were 2 huge negatives to this place. First was the price. It wasn't out of this world expensive, but just not worth what they charge. It came to about 25 dollars for 2 people. We only drank water and there were no add on sides. 

The second was, some nasty waiter walking around putting his fingers on everything. I saw this guy working at some desk, rummaging through drawers then back to serving the food. He was touching a lot of peoples foods with his bare hands, not washing or sanitizing. It seemed very needless to touch them the way he was.

They do not have the best breakfast in Pittsburgh, nor would I go here again.

I recommend the pancake here! It's very good! For omelets, they are pretty delicious, but too greasy for me. The home fries (potato) are must-try food. Also the size is so large, so it's suitable for hungry people! Really awesome!

If you can come here on weekdays, the restaurant is very good for you to have breakfast or brunch. If you are only available on weekend, come here as early as possible (maybe before 7:00am), because I don't think it's worth to wait for more than 30 mins even though I give it 4 stars.

This place is always busy! But that shows that it is soooo good! The last time I went there, I had the fish sandwich and it was so yummy! They bread the fish there and you can definitely tell. It tasted very fresh. It also came with coleslaw and fries. The fries were, ehhhhh ok. Nothing really special about them. The coleslaw was pretty good though! Next time I go, I definitely think I will try something from their breakfast menu. The other people I was with got breakfast items and really enjoyed them!

A Must-Visit restaurant if you ever visit the Pitt. This place gets super crowded, but it is well worth the wait. I had the pancake breakfast. Pancakes 1-5=4. Bacon 1-5=5. Eggs 1-5=3. Toast 1-5=3. Syrup 1-5=4.

When I think of Big Manly Breakfasts ... the kind that John Wayne, Jimmy Hoffa, and Batman would all eat I think of the King of all Pittsburgh Greasy Spoons, Deluca's.

Don't trick yourself into thinking you are getting anything beyond the best greasy spoon breakfast you've ever had.  Your waitress may be rude and there may be odd sticky substances on your table.  Don't like it?  Fuck you, that is ambiance here!

The place is, almost always, packed to the rafters (especially at breakfast time).  You will wait for a table.  The wait staff is typically old and cantankerous.  You will hear the query "whatta ya want, honey".  But the food is plentiful and out of this world.  Where else can you score a pepperoni omelette at any time of the day?  Pour some ketchup on that bad boy, order up a coke and I'm in heaven!

Probably my favorite diner. I will admit that I have never been to the original location in The Strip District, but I imagine the menus are pretty much the same.

Huge Omelettes! Great Lobster Bisque and sandwiches. This place is good for Breakfast or Lunch.  Be prepared to wait, as this is a popular place on the weekends for Breakfast.

There are too many things that I have had and liked here to list them all, but you can't go wrong with an Omelette or Pancakes for Breakfast. They have some Pancake and Waffle dishes that are covered in Whipped Cream and Syrup, they might as well be deserts. Good lunch options are the Burgers or various sandwiches. I enjoy the Club myself with a bowl of the Bisque and a side of Onion Rings.

Something for everyone, you will not be disappointed!

If your turned off by shabby furnishings and the whole dive vibe this place is not for you. If you could care less about your surroundings as long as the food is fantastic and plentiful the come to Delucas. My wife and 3 boys (11, 13 and 15) are breakfast junkies, seriously, we could ready breakfast 3 times a day 7 days a week. So we had to try Delucas while in Pittsburgh for a holiday. We saw it on Man Vs Food and DDD. It is a dive no doubt about it. But the food is awesome. We ate breakfast at around 930a and didn't eat again until 10p.....the portions are huge. Staff was friendly and prices where reasonable. What else could you ask for.

Despite all the hoopla, I can't say I was thrilled. Pros: they had a very friendly staff, the healthier option of buckwheat pancakes/waffles, and the French toast was on point. Cons: frozen strawberries, fake whipped cream, sub-par hash, and the absolute worst was the sausage. I'm 99% sure it was ground beef mixed with sausage at a respective 90:10 ratio. My friends and I will be sticking to Pamela's.

We were in the area and found this quaint diner. It's not that far from the airport and the menu offers breakfast food and lunches. Our party ordered a hot turkey sandwich, eggs Benedict with ham, and MOAB which is a breakfast burrito. Being from Texas we thought things were big but the servings here were BIG!!!  Our food was delicious and our server,Barry, was friendly and helpful. Our coffee cups were kept full and food was fresh and hot!  If you're in town we suggest you have at least one meal here!
Best breakfast in town. If you're not there at the crack of dawn, expect to wait in line. Worth it.

Went here based on recommendations from coworkers.  This area was pretty cool (strip district).  Alot of tourists though I have to say, granted we were there on a weekend.  The line was out the door for this place and smelled so good!  We decided to wait, and glad we did.  I ordered the mixed grill with sausage and my husband ordered some omelette (the one with chicken and spinach and some kind of cheese).  Both dishes were great!  I wish I had tried a pancake but I was trying to be healthy.  Oh well.  For healthy food, our dishes sure were satisfying and didn't taste all that healthy :)

The food was definitely not as GOOD AS USUAL... 

I was better off staying at home making my own breakfast .... french toast was hard and not hot..! 

The potatoes  had no flavor none WHATSOEVER...+ the potatoes  were hard. 

Overall I was not please with my meal. 

Trump is in the White House  now, so maybe the cooks are having a hard time readjusting from yesterday inauguration... 

Rating Deluca's 3 on pass experience....?

Okay, who needs a 100 year old grill to make awesome food and tasty memories?! Not me! Don't bite me! I get it. The one in downtown was the first and blah, blah. Listen, that's all fine and dandy but new is sometimes better. As soon as you walk in, the smell of non 100 year old establishment is refreshing and the place has a cozy friendly feel to it with very eye catching decor. You won't feel crowded. There's still wide open spaces. They have the BEST WAITRESS IN THE WORLD! Her name is Jamie and she's an absolute doll! All of our breakfast items were delicious! I ordered the pumpkin pancakes with a side of home fries and my hubby ordered the fried chicken and biscuits. EVERYTHING was yummy! The home fries were crispy. The chicken was juicy on the inside and crispy on the outside. The pumpkin pancakes were so fluffy and moist and perfect texture. The bathrooms are in the same level. You don't have to walk down a flight of slimy old stairs to get to them. Alright, enough said. Just stop by and experience it for yourself.
First time here entire family's meals were outstanding.  I had gourmet bacon club and it was unbelievable.  My daughter ordered a cheeseburger and it was the size of a football.  We'll be back.

There is a always a long line out the door (literally) for a reason. That reason is amazing diner food. The fact that it's cash only doesn't deter anyone from coming here. I've only been here once but I'm already sold. 

My husband and I ordered a few random things on the rather large menu and everything was pretty darn good. He tried the Reuben Melt with Lobster Bisque soup and I got the Country Fried Chicken, Eggs and Biscuits. The Lobster Bisque was surprisingly creamy and full of flavor for a diner soup. I'll admit, the Country Fried Chicken was a bit heavy for brunch but it was so amazing; every bite was worth the gazillion calories that I consumed. The chicken was well seasoned and moist, the batter was crispy and the creamy gravy made it all the more comforting. I could tell the biscuits were homemade or made very well bc they were so moist and great alongside everything else. 

If I could, I would come here every weekend but the line and wait can be discouraging (and I would gain so much weight). Awesome location, delicious diner food, but always crowded. Come prepared to wait.

Not feeling like contending with all the dahn-tahn Burgh traffic that inexplicably seems terrified of the tunnel monster, we decided to go to the Robinson location. What a brilliant choice that turned out to be. Breakfast was AMAZING! It was literally a ton of food and I ate all of it. Ok, almost all of it. I had the Steel City Breakfast of Champs with a waffle instead of pancakes. I just wanted to taste everything. As always though, my eyes were bigger than my stomach. I mean this thing had eggs, bacon, a giant, tender piece of ham steak, home fries, toast and a humungous waffle with strawberries and whipped cream. Everything was delicious, cooked to order, and the service was fantastic. Our server was awesome. My boyfriend had a 4 egg meat-o-rama omelette with home fries and toast. The huge smile on his face said it all. The place was super busy, and this was on a Friday afternoon. I can only imagine how busy it is on the weekend. So keep that in mind. However, it's well worth the wait. If you haven't been there yet, definitely check it aht!!!

People love this place, and for good reason. The food is good and there is a lot of it. My boyfriend thought everything was really good (he got the Steel City Breakfast of champs, which is a little bit of everything, and I got the MOAB burrrito). I thought that the burrito was perfectly "ok" and I would not order it again. All I could taste was tomato paste and a hint of taco seasoning. But it's just a matter of preference, I suppose. I will definitely be back and trying something different. I'll follow up on this review then.

Terrible service, food not worth the price. 

We waited for 20 minutes before the server took our order, and then another half hour for a salad. The whole place is filthy, but the service is absolutely abhorrent.
As with any place in the Strip there is a wait on the weekends. However, whether coming here for breakfast or lunch it is worth the wait. Delicious Diner food and fast service.

Trip to Pittsburgh....

Wasn't very welcoming.... no hi, hello or how are you? when entering. Dirty tables, empty jelly containers under the table and staff checked on at the end of the meal. ooooohhh and the flies.... 

As for the food.....
I ordered pancakes,  philly cheesesteak omelette and home fries.

Pancakes-Nothing special 
Omelette- Pretty good no complaints 
Home fries- Bland and mushy

Went there for lunch, had a steak and cheese sub, it was unqiue because they used thick slices of steak in the sub. But the experience was kinda so so. I'll have to try the breakfest, since I love breakfest and their supposed to be good at that. We'll see !
