-Dolce da Choccolato: Words cannot describe or do it justice. It's a crepe filled with Nutella and strawberries topped with whipped cream and dusted with powdered sugar. I love crepes and ordered it thinking it would be like any other crepe. I was WRONG! This sucker was at least 12" long, yes seriously a foot long. I have never seen strawberries that big before. It took both of us to eat it and we barely we able to finish it.

The term "Best breakfast in town" is a lie. It needs to be changed to "Best breakfast on the planet!"

Excellent food.  The French toast taste delicious and the chicken and waffles are pretty good too, not Roscoe's House of Chicken and Waffles, Maggianos, or Chicago's Home of Chicken and Waffles but for Pittsburgh they are probably at or near the top.  The pancake was good as the bacon eggs and potatoes.  They give you a sausage patty the size of a burger but all in all it was good.

The presentation leaves much to be desired so I can't give it 5 stars but the food is fantastic!

DeLuca's is a Pittsburgh landmark with a great reputation... and I found it to be "all that and a bag of chips."  

Get there early... as it gets packed on the weekends.  There is no wait list, so you need to get in line.  Once seated, I found the wait staff was very attentive.

The food was delicious and I will look to return here next time I'm in the Burgh.   Loved the Pittsburgh Slam with 2 eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage and French Toast (Lingonberry Preserve & Lemon).

The Coffee is good and the menu has a lot of interesting dishes for both breakfast and lunch.  As I was here for breakfast, I hope to go back soon to explore some of the other dishes.

I was expecting more from this restaurant. I was enjoying my husbands efforts in putting this date together. The food was slightly disappointing.  I had biscuits and sausage gravy. I received biscuits and floury tasting gravy. The sausage was M.I.A. My husband had the lobster bisque soup. The same lobster M.I.A. The staff was kind to us but very busy. I had that experience but will I go back NO! I will however visit the strip over and over it is a blast of fun. Take plenty of money with you because you will spend it.

CASH ONLY!

When in PIT for business I was told that I had to go to Deluca's for breakfast.  Now, I am telling you the same.  This place is in the Strip and has been there for a very long time.  A nice variety of items on the menu.  This is old school dinner at it's very best.

CASH ONLY!
CASH ONLY!
CASH ONLY!

I stopped by here today with my parents and sister for breakfast.  We were debating over a place to eat in the Strip District and I offered up DeLuca's as I have had decent experiences there before and there is always a line out the door waiting for seats.  We arrived at around 9:15 and walked right into the restaurant and were seated in the upstairs portion.  The inside of this place is nothing special and looks like many other diners.  They did have a t shirt from man v food (circa 2006) on the wall above us.

For my breakfast I decided to start off with a coffee which was poured within seconds of ordering and delivered to our table.  Then after a few minutes of deliberating over the huge menu I ended up going with the Huevos Rancheros for my breakfast.  After ordering our waitress disappeared and I am pretty sure that I never saw her again until we had to ask another waitress to get her for our check.  That meant that after about 10 minutes of waiting with an empty cup of coffee, I ended up helping myself to the pot that was sitting nearby.  I never did get a third cup which would have been nice.  Anyways, after a reasonable amount of time our food made it out to our table and my Huevos Rancheros looked pretty good.  The egg was sunny side up and whenever I cut through it, the yolk dripped nicely onto the tortilla, cheese, salsa and chorizo underneath it.  It tasted decently enough although I would have personally liked it quite a bit spicier.  After I was about half way through my my meal the avocado that was supposed to come on it materialized to our table.  It was maybe 1/4 of a total avocado cut into 4 very small slices which were quickly gone.  Whenever my family and I had finished our meals we proceeded to wait about 10 minutes for our waitress to come to our table.  Finally giving up on that we asked another waitress to ask our waitress for the bill.  She did and about 10 minutes later and after again asking our waitress for the bill, we were able to pay.  The sad thing is that we were trying to get out of there and there was a huge line of people outside waiting to get in.

The bottom line for me is that I would probably avoid coming here in the future.  While the food was decent tasting I found it to be overpriced and our service was just miserable.
The pancakes were amazing! I had a blueberry pancake and bacon and my husband had the French toast combo. Everything was amazing!
People talk about the line the wait etc but it was fast getting in and getting served food was good and great price service real Pittsburghy and I loved it

Ok, so up until this point, I would say Deluca's gets 4 stars. However, yesterday I had an experience to give them that extra star. I always get one of the eggs Benedict or something in the sandwich section or a regular breakfast with pancakes. 

But wait so back to yesterday, we had multiple servers come up and wait on us and try to fill our water or get us stuff. On top of that, my friend doesn't eat pork so he asked for all turkey sausage with his meal. Unfortunately it came out with bacon piled on it. However, the waitress immediately took it back once we said it wouldn't have been a big deal but he doesn't eat pork and they started making a whole new plate of everything. 

I decided to branch out and get the chicken and waffle. I'm picky about chicken and waffles no matter where I go because I've had some great ones and some ok ones. But let me tell you, this no frills chicken and waffle was amazing. It's nothing fancy, which is what I expected. But the chicken was soooo juicy and breaded and fried perfectly and the waffle had just enough sweetness to it to balance it out and was dense but fluffy at the same time. And the best part is it comes with a side of eggs. Usually when I get chicken and waffles I want eggs and get them as a side but this one it comes with it and I got them over easy and it was great. 

Honestly I can't wait to go get it again.

When a place has a line out the door on a cold January Sunday morning, it's a good sign about the food. We did end up waiting a while to be seated, but it was worth it to enjoy an old-school breakfast in this Pittsburg institution.  I got a veggie omelet which I thoroughly enjoyed; others in my party ordered diverse items from their extensive breakfast menu. From eggs to pancakes to the biggest ham slice any of us had ever seen, everything was well prepared and the service was great as well.  The atmosphere here is unique; the place is a bit (or a lot) of a time warp, which was fantastic in and of itself. This place knows what works, and has apparently just stuck with that, for decades.  Do check this place out- it's worth the wait!

Came here because our Lyft driver recommended it.  Good food and lots of it.  This is a true old school diner, not fancy at all.  Expedient service, probably because of lots of people wanting to eat there. Large menu and abundant portions.  It's not exactly cheap but a good value for what you get.

My husband loved his Eggsceptional egg sandwich.  It was served on thick cut Italian toast and very delicious.  My spinach, tomato and feta omelet was good but a little overcooked.

Get there early to avoid a wait, but don't get discouraged if there is one.  The place is a lot bigger than it looks and they move people in and out quickly.

And remember -- Cash only.
Best breakfast in town! It's always busy on the weekends so you may have to wait for a table but it's worth it. Food is always fantastic and service is great!

Please add more stars as an option because Deluca's deserves all the stars!
I came here with a large party for brunch on a snowy and very cold Saturday morning.  That didn't stop a line of people from standing outside to get in.  We, however, had reservations and walked right in much to chagrin of said folks waiting in the 5 degree weather.
A table was waiting with a reserved table tent on us and we were immediately approached by our friendly server.  Two people had bailed (due to weather) and a few of our friends were running behind (due to weather) but the server had no qualms about telling us not to worry and to keep the extra two seats for our purses.  
Once the entire crew arrived we ordered and received our dishes promptly.  I had the Super Bowl omelet which contained mashed potatoes, kielbasa and onions.  And that may seem a little odd to some but I tell you this was the most delicious breakfast I've ever eaten.  It came with a side of hot baked apples which I added to the omelet and it complimented it beautifully.  This also came with toast.  
So, so, so very good.  There was not one complaint at the table and we all pledged to come back again soon.
Hands down better than Pamelas.  Love the sci-fi space theme.  The line is manageable.  Try Tuesday morning at 9am, no one is there.
Amazing homemade food, good service, great breakfast spot in the Strip District!
Quick, no frills, but very tasty establishment. Get your hash browns extra crispy!

French Toast is amazing. Definitely worth the wait in line. However, I've had the same waiter the last two times who was less than inviting. He spoke so loud and uninterested it felt like he was yelling at us. Despite the relatively poor service (he didn't even come back to check on us) it's still the best breakfast ever! I keep going back for more.
Deluca's in the strip district def defines a trip to Pittsburgh - I ordered hot turkey sandwich with gravy and mash- with out a doubt good! Staff was friendly...

Well done diner food.  Deluca's is pretty good for a greasy spoon.

The line moves surprisingly fast outside, so don't be daunted by a wait.  And once inside, staff is quick and friendly.

We had breakfast: traditional eggs, biscuits, meats, potatoes - all were very good.   The breakfast burritos are pretty big, too; best to share.  All the breakfast meats (sausages, bacon, and chiorzo) were fresh and flavorful.

Went in around 2:15 pm to get lunch. We didn't realize they closed at 3. They seated us and everyone was polite. The food was ok. Food was maybe 2-2.5 stars out of 5. The entire 35 minutes we were there the 8 or so workers sat 1 table over from us and spent the entire time trashing another coworker and other customers. They were so loud we could hardly hold our own conversation. It was awkward. They were counting the money, mopping all around us and sweeping huge piles of mess by our table as we ate. Such an awful experience and with the food not being that good, I probably won't be back.

Okay so we attempted to go to the strip district location but the line was so long we went to Pamela's instead which we loved! Check out my review of that place.

This place was in a shopping plaza so the wait was 15 mins at most. People say the food is the same as that on the strip but if that's the case I'm so happy we didn't wait in that line. We were underwhelmed. The food was average diner food. I love a good casual greasy spoon place but that place was absolutely nothing special. We wont be returning.

it is very difficult to get my 7 year old nephew to eat ANYTHING.  We go to dinner and he will eat a bite and say he is full.  Well, that is until we went to Delucas.  He got a full adult order of french toast and ate it!  Then asked if we could come there again when we come to Pittsburgh!  His approval alone is enough for a 4 star review but it didn't hurt that 6 more adults and 1 child also enjoyed their meals!  the fried fish sandwich was great and the homemade sausage they serve is a must if you are going with a breakfast entree!  

Thanks Deluca for getting my nephew to eat a whole meal!

I came one Saturday morning for brunch and I must say it's worth the wait. The line moves surprisingly fast because the waiters and busboys are super efficient. Tried the feta spinach omelet and their chocolate banana hotcake special. I was very satisfied and even more satisfied with the staff. They were attentive, constantly pouring coffee, and always checking up on my friend and I. The atmosphere is warm and the customers all seem to be enjoying themselves.

I went today with my boyfriend around 10:30am. We were sat quickly at the counter despite the fact that they were busy. The food came out quickly, both were large portions, and our server was awesome! Definitely a must go to breakfast spot when visiting Pittsburgh! Be sure to stop at the ATM as it is cash only!

Visiting Pittsburg for the weekend, we picked Deluca's solely based on the number of positive Yelp reviews, but I really thought it was just so-so. 
 
The staff was amazing and the whole place runs like a machine.  We got there ~9:15 and there were about six groups ahead of us, but we didn't wait long since they're exceptionally fast at getting tables cleared and ready for the next party.  An empty plate never sat longer than a few seconds and our coffee was always full.
 
I ordered way too much food, as usual:  Sausage gravy and biscuits with scrambled eggs and potatoes with an extra single "fancy pancake" with lingonberries.  My husband ordered some sort of breakfast burrito which I didn't try.  

The sausage gravy and biscuits came out first and they were AMAZING.  The side of eggs and potatoes and the pancake came out about five minutes later; not really a biggie, but I'm not really sure if they just forgot and threw it together when I asked where it was because the eggs almost seemed like somebody started to make fried eggs and then decided at the last second that they should be scrambled.  They were runny and yolky in spots and white and fried-eggy in other spots (pretty much exactly like you would expect a chopped-up fried egg to look).  Maybe this is the way that they always are, but it was really unappetizing.  The pancake was also off somehow.  I looked around at everybody else's pancakes and they were light and fluffy, but mine was deflated with an almost rubbery texture.  It's like they used crepe batter, but it was thicker than I would expect a crepe to be.  The potatoes were good, but nothing remarkable.  Maybe my expectations were just too high...

Visited this Labor Day for breakfast. We actually intended to go to Pamela's, but they were closed today. There was a line at Deluca's, as usual, but it moved pretty quickly and we were seated in about 15 minutes. 

Service was brusque, no nonsense...not friendly but not outright unfriendly either I suppose. I had my usual breakfast burrito, good as always, and quite filling. I tried some of the hub's waffle with ice cream and whatnot on top...delish.

I noticed today that their booths along the side are rather uncomfortable...the seat feels too shallow so you feel like you are just about the fall off it the whole time and your butt starts to hurt. Really not that big a deal though.

All in all, still some good food.

Visiting from California to beautiful Pittsburg for the Steelers game.  Was told by all the locals that this is a must go to place for breakfast if we visiting in town.  Got there  and the wait was about 5 minutes (we got lucky) and all I can say is this place is one of the best breakfast places my wife and I have ever eaten at. I had the friend chicken and waffle with a side of potatoes and my wife had a waffle with some ham.  Simply amazing and the service was very good.  

If you visiting Pittsburg, this place is a must go to!!!!!!  We honestly liked it better than Pamela's.

Meh - Nothing special just a greasy spoon diner serving up decent but very average breakfast. Hollandaise sauce out of a mix, average potatoes, average pancakes, really nothing to the place except it is a Pittsburgh icon, much like Primanti brothers, it's legendary for what it once was not for what it is now.

I'm glad we didn't wait for breakfast and if I was going show off a breakfast spot in Pittsburgh I think Pamela's would be my first choice.

I like Deluca's.  I think the place has a good Pittsburgh atmosphere and the service is always great.  I really do enjoy coming here every once in a while when I'm down in the strip.  That said, the food doesn't generally blow me out of the water.  It's definitely good, but I have to say that I prefer the Dor-Stop in Dormont for breakfast.

We went over the weekend.  Our service was great, as usual, everyone is very friendly.  I got corned beef hash (something the Dor-Stop is lacking), and it was alright.  It's hard to find really amazing corned beef hash - if you're ever in the Cleveland area and that's your thing, check out Big Al's.  Best I've ever had.

My boyfriend got a breakfast burrito, which is his go-to most places.  He said it was good, but definitely preferred it elsewhere.

Overall, I think we would probably be a lot more excited about this place if we didn't have a place we liked better right near us.

i could probably count on one hand the number of times that i've waited in line to eat at a place with fluorescent lights.  this is one of them.

we waited in line outside next to the "best breakfast in pittsburgh" sign for about 30 minutes before being seated.  the wait was partly due to today being labor day, and partially due to our showing up at 11:30am.  was the wait worth it?  every minute of it.

+1 for a menu FULL of wonderful breakfast items.  most items are non-traditional.  deluca's has many non-standard items that are locally well-known.

+1 for friendly service amidst the demands of 100+ hungry people.

+1 for a great location.  strip district.

+1 for relatively quick service.

+1 for the best (and largest) omelet i've ever had, named the "bionic omelet".

+1 for the best overall breakfast i've ever had.

-1 for cash only.

highly recommended.  favorite of both locals and tourists.  i will likely return.  come early to avoid any lines.

After reading some of the negative  remarks I had to chime in.  First and foremost please realize this is a local, greasy spoon, neighborhood, breakfast like dinner with history, reputation and the Burg flare.  Is that a run-on sentence? Anyway, I doubt anyone from California will "get it".  Although I would expect those from the east coast or even the great lake cities to be able to identify with it.  This isn't a bad thing.  I appreciate trendy light food as much as the next Yelper, but don't go here looking for a fusion dinner with wi-fi and a coffee bar.

Yes, bring cash, be willing to wait in line, and it is a little dirty.   I am a coffee snob, so they could improve their coffee.

But, the staff is fun, the kitchen is quick and the portions are big.  The food is good hardy breakfast food.  My son particularly likes to get the waffles with ice cream.  Being an athlete who can't consumes enough calories in a day, I say go for it!  The other  kids like the pancakes while my wife and I like the omelets... 

Enjoy before heading out to the strip to buy some fresh food!  
Or, if its been a long night,  enjoy before heading home to bed...You decide.

I don't understand why people line up out the door and down the street for this place. It seems to be very overrated and overpriced. We went early Tuesday morning and there was no wait (thankfully).

I came in from out of town and was told by several people that I had to go to Deluca's. I got the country breakfast and I was less than wowed by what I got. My meal came out to me in portions as they were ready at separate times. The fried chicken is merely a chicken tender with gravy and shredded cheese poured on top (not enough to put any on my biscuit that came out halfway through). The homefries were good. 

Apparently, it is a seat yourself and grab your own menu kind of place. Another customer paying ended up handing us two menus before any staffers acknowledged our existence.

Our waitress was very nice, so I kept them at 3 stars.

Haven't been here in a long time and we looked forward to visiting this establishment today since we drove to Pittsburgh to visit family.  Very disappointed! Prices went up, cash only, owner/Manager very rude! Had to ask for coffee refill twice! Overall breakfast was good and plenty of it too! Hostess very friendly. We won't be visiting this establishment anytime soon! I rather revisit Door Stop in  Dormont or Bobs in Carnegie! Adios DeLucas!

The food here is inexpensive and excellent.  I got the mixed grill, which was featured on man vs food. There are so many vegetables in it and the portions are huge... I could only eat half. Our table also split a banana split crepe. YUM. Would definitely recommend. Get here early on a weekend, we waited in line at 10am for about 30 minutes. The line moves quickly and food comes out fast. I'm only deducting a star because I could see the kitchen and toast is handled with bare hands.  Also, if you're getting toast, get the Italian bread. The Italian bread they serve here with toast and eggs Benedict is delicious, crusty and fresh. (Yes, I ate the toast even though someone touched it...germs build the immune system, right?!)

We didn't really wait that long in line, maybe 10-15 minutes.
While we were seated pretty quickly, we didn't get served until after the couple next to us had been seated and waited on.  NOT COOL!
Food was good, I had Texas Cinnamon French Toast and Turkey Sausage.  Toast had a hint of onions and peppers which was off putting but overall good. Very good turkey sausage.  Husband had Eggs Benedict hash with chicken and avocado.  He said he didn't think there was any avocado on the plate.  
Overall good food, underwhelmed by the wait staff, maybe that's why there's always a line out the door.

Ooooeeeeeee 
this is Americaaaaa.
tipical american interior 
huge portion of dishes 
fast service. 
but not all food is good.
I think 4* it's fare for this place

This place is american %100

Huge portion
 lot of people and good atmosphere
Always when I  around Always stop py

We had 15 people in our party as we ended our stay in Pittsburgh for our family wedding. It took us two hours to get everyone together in the hotel lobby just to get ready to leave for this family style restaurant...and it was going on lunchtime, but this place served breakfast all day long. And WHAT a breakfast it was. Some 
In our group had lunch, but most, breakfast. Huge menu selection. My western style omelet was hot, full of veggies and ham, side of real home fries grilled and crispy!  The 12 inch plate was filled!  Cheese dripping off the side!  The waitress was not flustered at our large group and accommodated our party with a professional flair. All the food was hot and served us almost all at the same time!  Couldn't finish.  Wanted to. Delish!!! Recommend highly. Great food,flavor, service!  Small but adequate booths on the side... Tables down the middle, of which we commandeered three for our party.

The portions are big; the food is good; the kitchen is quick; and the prices are reasonable.  What more could you want in a greasy spoon?

I finally got around to trying this Pittsburgh landmark in the Strip District, and I was pleasantly surprised by what I found.  The pancakes were delicious (thick and rich), and everything else was acceptable or better--not to mention plentiful (with my meal I received a mountain of home fries, eggs, bacon, sausage and toast...not bad, especially given the prices).

The one strike against this place (aside from the waits if you come at peak times) was that the waiter acknowledged but then ignored all requests for drink refills, leaving me thirsty for more water and my companion rationing the smallest $2 cup of diner coffee anyone ever received.  If I find this issue persistent over multiple visits (and I'll certainly be back), that will probably cost them a star, but for now I'll overlook one server having one bad day and give this place a reasonably enthusiastic endorsement.

Deluca's is too good a value to not try again.
Breakfast was fantastic! I had a create your own omelette!! I was so fool from breakfast, I didn't have to eat lunch!!

I gave it another shot- Great service- great food.  Must have just been a bad day the last time or they got rid of the bad people there.

love it once again.  I will be back.

When we first got there the line was very long,  but it was worth the wait for sure!!! My boyfriend and I both ordered the breakfast burritos. The burritos were so delicious!  Another thing that was pretty cool was we were seated in the booth right next to where Tom Cruise sat in a scene from "Jack Reacher"!!! I think we'll make it a tradition coming here on the weekends for breakfast! Definitely 5 stars!!

HUGE portions of tasty food. Prompt service. Cash only. Preferred breakfast here over Pamela's. Got a cinnamon roll pancake, sweet Lord it was so delish I didn't even want to share a bite with my guy! The body builder egg white omelette with chicken, spinach, and Asiago was much better than anticipated. Omelette came with oatmeal, fresh fruit, and fresh Italian toast. Enough for two. Go here!

Dinery diner you've ever dined at. Huge super filling menu, awesome staff, friendly faces and all the interaction or lack there of you want. Highly recommend the MOAB (that's pronounced moe-ahb NOT M-O-A-B).
Place is a typical diner setting. Very friendly staff! (Thanks Mary)! Food was okay. Not the best ham I've tasted. Potatoes were a little burnt and eggs were over medium/hard.

Classic, no frills diner with fantastic food. The pancakes, mixed grill and omelets are my favorite things to order. It's fun to watch them cook at the grill too. The bacon is perfectly crisp and thick. Yes the lines can be long if you go on a weekend but it's well worth the wait. Even better is going during the week. Cash only, so be prepared :)

A much-needed non-chain restaurant in Robinson township?!?!! They are too few and far between. While my heart lies with the original in the strip, my taste buds don't discriminate. The same awesome food is found here. One of these days, I will tear myself away from the omelets and mixed grill to try some of non-breakfast items that look fantastic coming out of the grill area. It's so nice to have a non-chain option in this area!!!  BONUS POINTS...my waitress offered me coffee to go! Great service AND food

Super breakfast in a real institution.   Great cheese steak omelet, wife loved eggs Benedict,  kids loved the French toast.   Cash only.   Walking around the strip district is interesting as well.   Parked for $5 down the road in a gravel lot ( car full of luggage).

This place is really quantity over quality. Sure, you can order a ridiculously large amount of food and snap an Instagram picture, but the quality ain't that much better than any other decent diner. I'm not saying it's bad. It's pretty good, but people standing in line for over an hour is really unnecessary. If you want to come here, get up the extra hour early and get here before 8.
Great pancakes and delicious eggs, but the diner felt a bit dingy and dirty. It could definitely use a facelift, and expect a wait.

The Strip on the weekend is always busy and the day of a parade busier still.  But if you get a brave soul (Dad) to wait in line in the cold it works out well.  I was able to hit Penn Mac and do some other shopping.   Think it was about a 30 minute wait but when it's 25 degrees giving a good coffee as a peace offering makes it better.

I had eggs over medium, bacon, etc. which was good for the price but my eggs were more on the over easy side.  Others had the special - French toast with strawberries and got fudge.  I was told it was wonderful.

A definite Pittsburgh dive - and a must try.  Just beware of the stairs to the restroom.

I went to this place for the first time today by myself while Christmas shopping because it looked nice and nostalgic inside with the 50s diner look.
Long story short while sitting at the counter for quick service, or so I thought,  the waitress who wasnt around was told by the cashier that I was waiting to order, mean while she just continued to joke around and laugh with the cook while I'm sitting there waiting to order. I finally got fed up waiting and just left. So I cannot comment on the food because I never got a chance to try it but I can comment that the service was terrible !!

One of the best breakfast places in Pittsburgh. My first time here, and it was packed on a Saturday, but we were seated right away. We had attentive service, but we took a while to order due to how confusing the menu is to read. I got the Eggs Benedict and it was fantastic. Our food was delivered quickly, considering on how busy they were. Would recommend to anyone.

I know this place typically has a long wait but somehow I snuck in on a Saturday afternoon and sat at the bar for breakfast right away.  The service was amazingly fast.  I ordered the Huevos Rancheros and it literally came out in less than 30 seconds.  I was sitting next to the grill so I saw that they really made it and didn't just reheat something and their speed is impressive!  The food was pretty tasty but it had a bit too much chorizo (and I love meat).  Huge portion sizes and definitely a very Pittsburgh sort of place.  Don't go here if you are looking for something healthy ;)

I went back again later with a couple of friends and we all had a great experience.  The portions are HUGE and everything was delicious.  I think my friend's omelet had like 6 eggs and at least a pound of meat.
For breakfast, I had a cheese omellete with toast here, and it tasted delicious.

After seeing Deluca's on TV, my friend had to go during our trip. We've walked by in previous years and it had a huge line. 
     This year, we walked right into disappointment. We sort of expected something special but it was more like Alice's Diner. Old booths, old equipment and old grease mist floating in the air making it hard to breath.
     To be honest the food was good but average. Not worth all the TV excitement or driving more than a mile or two for. And not as good as other places near by.
     The service was good and pretty fast. 
     All in all it was an average meal, in an average diner. I will say that some of the lunch menu items sounded more interesting.

The signature breakfast burrito was a dud. A tortilla wrapped around some greasy bacon and home fries with some dry scrambled eggs served with a glop of canned refried beans.  The waffled sundae was good but too pricey.  This place is typical of what was once a quaint hole in the wall diner that served good food, but became popular and now just cranks out mediocre food.  Is crowded because of its rep not for the quality of its food.

Yes, Deluca's is very good .  Yes, they make a great breakfast.  However, is it worth waiting in line forever on Sunday morning? No.

Deluca's is an iconic place that people seem to swarm to and I appreciate that but I go early in the AM and enjoy their food without the really crazy waits others seem to love to endure.

Weightlifter breakfast is really tastey.

The highlights:
Good servers that keep checking in on you as necessary. Everyone we talked to was very nice.
Very good pancakes, whether they're plain or with syrup.
Great home fries. Very crispy and oily, just as i would hope for.
Good eggs
Good crispy bacon

The lowlights:
They don't offer pure maple syrup, even for an extra charge. I know it's expensive to give out, but I'd gladly pay for it.
Weak coffee / iced coffee. It's pretty terrible, actually. Also, their only sugar sub. is knockoff sweet n low. Our waitress was great and offered me acouple of Splenda from her own stash. It's a small thing.

Notes:
Milkshake was thin but tasty and service was fast. I'd come back here if i were in the city!
Breakfast is always great here!!! Today an omelette with provolone,  kielbasa,  hot sausage. And onions!!! Sided with some fried potatoes and fresh Mancinis bread, a Pittsburgh staple for sure!!!

Wow! First time in Pittsburg, first time to eat here. Everyone raves about it and I can see why. 

Service was similar to southern hospitality which I sound odd for a northern state. The real definition of an old school breakfast diner. CASH ONLY! 


We had the seafood Benedict, banana praline crepe, Reese's hot cake sundae, and coffee. 

The seafood Benedict was excellent! Perfect amount of seafood, avocado, and runny yolk to cover the toasted bread underneath. 

The coffee is bomb. The hot cake sundae is a perfect dessert to share for 2-3 people. And the banana praline crepe is decent (the banana is just cold wrapped in a hot crepe with a touch of sweet ricotta and yummy pralines. I would have liked it more with sliced cooked bananas)

Long waits on the weekend . 
Omelet was okay. The coffee and service is good ,
and it is convenient to the shops I frequent on the strip.
Would recommend going early to beat the crowds .

I give 5 stars sparingly and Deluca's is completely deserving. We waited outside in the sweltering heat, during prime brunch time, for almost 30 minutes but knew it was worth the wait. There is nothing fancy or classy about this place which is actually quite endearing. The menu? Basically anything you can imagine for brunch. Really happy we got to visit this Pittsburgh staple after almost a year of living here. Portions are insanely big but we love leftovers so it wasn't an issue.

My first visit to Pittsburgh. I love little greasy diners, and Deluca's was great. I ate the "Pigs in a Blanket" crepe and ordered a chocolate milkshake as well. Both were very delicious, and I would love to try some of the other items on their menu. I love breakfast, greasy diners and paying in cash (the last one is a lie). 

I would definitely go back.

First time here and it is absolutely amazing! I had the Steel City Breakfast of Champs. I got my eggs scrambled and they were perfectly cooked...not over cooked and a bit hard like most places do. The hot sausage is definitely hot! Steer clear if spicy is not your thing. Ordered bacon extra crispy and was cooked just right. Pancakes were so yummy! The outside rim was just a bit crunchy with a fluffy center. Very tasty!!! Great food for a great price! Bring your appetites because the portions are very generous!!!

As other reviews state, there is a long wait. We waited for about 40 min.

The hubby got the famous breakfast burrito. He said it was good, but it was definitely missing something. Also, the flavor profile was only "chorizo." we have had better.

I got the huevos rancheros. Good, but also lacking something.

We split a pumpkin pancake, and a cinnamon bun pancake. The pumpkin was great, but the cinnamon bun was still completely raw in the middle, like, oozing batter, which was gross.

Good overall, not great. We have had better.

Gonna try pamelas next...

Don't really get the hype about this place.

PROS: huge portions

CONS: bad service (the waitress didn't get my order right, and ignored us for almost the entire meal), hard and uncomfortable benches, small (we were seated right next to the door, and cold air was blowing in the entire time we were eating), food just wasn't that good. Breakfast burrito was OK. Mixed grilled was bland.
Fast service and delicious food. Great prices. Cinnamon  sugar french toast was to die for. This was my first trip but there will definitely be more.

Awesome Breakfast.  Try any of the flavored pancakes.  My wife has had a few of the different flavors and they all have been outstanding.  Also try the Breakfast sandwich on homemade bread with Uncle Charlies Hot Sausage, it is by far the best Breakfast Sandwich I have ever had.

I've driven past Deluca's Diner for over a year now, each time with the intention of eating there. Because I usually visit the Strip on the weekends, however, there would always be a (long) line outside of Deluca's. After asking a few potential patrons how long they have been waiting, to which their responses would be between 30 and 45 minutes, I just walked away.

Sorry, while I consider myself a patient guy, I can only last so long before I hulk out from hanger.

This is why I make a point of avoiding diners on weekend mornings, unless I have a snack before surrendering myself to the dreaded line.

Anyway, I finally had the chance to come here on a Wednesday morning with a friend for brunch. We found street parking without needing to circle around the area for half an hour and fume silently over endless pedestrians crossing the streets. As expected, there was a line, but it was nowhere near as long as that on weekend mornings. The people in front of us said that they've been waiting for 5-10 minutes. Not bad.

Within 10 minutes, the hostess seated me and my friend at a table near the back of the diner. The wall to which our table stood adjacent proudly displayed their achievements of being recognized by former Steelers players, and of being featured in movies and on "Man vs. Food." Miscellaneous posters pertaining to Pittsburgh and diner-esque themes covered the rest of the walls.

Our waiter promptly introduced himself, gave us our menus, and asked if we'd like anything to drink. My friend requested water; I requested water and coffee. Within a few minutes, we had some water and I had my steaming mug of coffee. I usually take my coffee black, and this coffee was pretty good. After perusing the menu and debating whether we should get omelettes, pancakes or waffles or French toast, or breakfast sandwiches for almost 10 minutes, we finally made our decision. By this time, a waiter would have checked up on us at least twice; our waiter hadn't come by. We waited a few more minutes and eventually he came and took our orders briskly.

Within 10 minutes, we got our food. I got the Italian Veggie Frittata, my friend got the "Da Burgh" Philly Cheesesteak omelette, and we got full stack of French toast with strawberries. Our omelettes were excellent. Both of ours came with homefries and biscuits. My omelette with stuffed with veggies and a good amount of cheese, while my friend's was stuffed with juicy, tender steak, onions, and peppers. The homefries were all right. I came across several pieces that were undercooked and several pieces that were charred. I thought the biscuits tasted great but my friend thought that it must have been made using Bisquick because of their texture and taste. I didn't care; I just slathered my strawberry jam on them and stuffed my face.

According to the menu, the French toast is made using bread from Mancini's bakery. The toast itself was good, but the "fresh" strawberries on top brought down the dish. Upon arriving at our table, the strawberries lacked their vibrant red color; instead, they looked wilted and gray-red. I tasted one and I immediately thought "defrosted frozen strawberries." It was so mushy and lacked any taste. I then proceeded to slide the strawberries off my piece of French toast before finishing it.

I guess I was loving the coffee because by the end of our meal, I had downed almost four cups of coffee! Whew, I knew I was going to be jittery today (with an overactive bladder).

Overall, our meal was good, but nothing really impressed me. I found the quality of the food to be that of a typical diner. Even the breadth of the menu wasn't too impressive. I've been to several diners with similarly extensive, if not more, menus. Nevertheless, I suppose DeLuca's gets a lot of attention and praise because it is a historical venue and a staple of Pittsburgh, just like Pamela's Diner.

Anyway, as for any diner, I would come here again if I woke up in the late morning with a hangover after a night of heavy drinking and couldn't will myself to cook my own breakfast/brunch. Just remember to be prepared for a long line and a long wait if you decide to go on a weekend morning. Bring a snack or a sports drink (and a sleeping bag for those who partied a bit too hard the previous night) to tide you over during your wait.

A line long enough to spot miles away, in downtown Pittsburgh. Everyone comes here and lines up for the amazing food that Deluca's serves. 

We didn't want to wait for hours, so we called and got the food picked up. There was still a bit of wait, but nothing compared to standing in line. We got the food, and ate them in the car. 

I would always lower my expectations about half a Yelp star for take outs, simply because it takes away the whole "display food on plate" and "serving it glamorously to the customers" thing. And also, food in a box doesn't always taste amazing. Surprisingly, everything we ordered was bomb. The portions were massive, and they were simply satisfying, perfect brunch material food. Only thing that went wrong was, they messed up our order.

We stopped by around Sunday afternoon before the pirates game.We sat at the counter,and I had the cheeseburger omelette which was wasn't on the menu,but they still managed to cook it up.My friend had the 6 egg omelette with the works inside of it.I was visiting from NYC and this spot was on top of the list,and it lived up to the hyped.

Love Deluca's for a good weekend brunch spot!  Their menu is huge and there is definitely something for everyone, even if they want lunch.  Even though the restaurant is large, it is always packed and there is always a line.  The good news is, they get people in and out fast so the line moves pretty quickly.  The experience is always a bit hectic but the food makes it worth it. The portions at Deluca's are huge and so far everything I've tasted has been delicious.  My boyfriend makes sure to always order the cinnamon roll pancake which is a pancake with cinnamon and frosting glaze on it and it's amazingggg! I don't think you'll be disappointed with anything on the menu! Come for a fun and delicious breakfast in the strip district.  Also don't forget that it is CASH ONLY!

I enjoyed this place a lot with a friend of mine. We are both visiting from out of state. We couldn't decide between this one and another restaurant around the corner but this had more unique selections.

It was a quit turn around, seated, served, eat, and out. They were vey efficient and obviously have been opened for a while. It was all cash only though so I hope they will get with the times soon. I would've ordered more food if I could've used my card but alas I only had $10. 

I ordered the apple cinnamon bun crepe. It was a good decision! So good. It had ricotta cheese melted in it and whipped cream on top. It was delicious and full of sugar so be warned. My friend got an omelet and she also loved it. The portions are big. Everything looked delicious around us too.

I enjoyed the venue, it was packed but not cramped. Old feeling but clean. It was a diner, so don't expect anything crazy. Will be back one day to try the other foods.

I have eaten at DeLuca's in the Strip District so I was anxious to try this location. I was meeting a friend for lunch. When I saw that they had Biscuits and Gravy on the menu I was totally psyched!!  When they arrived at the table the wind blew out of my sails. The "sausage" was pink. YUCK! It was room temperature. One of biscuits was hard as a rock.  I was completely disappointed. 
My friend ordered fried chicken tenders and fries. Her looked delicious and she enjoyed it.   
Since it's Deluca's I will give them a second chance but I will definitely order something different.

We stopped at Pittsburgh specifically to eat here on our way to NY.  And it's worth the detour! Love the food! It's ridiculously delicious! No wonder there were people on line waiting for a table. I got the country chicken with biscuits and gravy, eggs and home fries, and man oh man, they would make a killin' in NY! I also tasted the banana pancake. DeLuca did not disappoint, not one iota. Service is fast and courteous as well. A must for everyone!!!

Five stars in MY book. First of all it is very hard to find a diner where I can sit and eat in downtown Pittsburgh. So the FACT that I walked thirty minutes away from my hotel to come here and they did not disappoint is mind blowing.
Now,  Let me take a moment to thank the other Yelpers that has viewed this place because of you guys I am fulfilled. 
Now back to this spot. It was a great experience. I was recognized immediately once I walked in nd everything my waitress offered was delicious. I orderd the Steel City Breakfast of Champs breakfast and it was soooooo good. Not to mention I got my money worth. I feel great and satisfied. They were very attentive with my order and I appreciated the conversation. Hey told m the history of the place as well as knowing this is cash only place.I really enjoyed myself. I recommend his place to anyone looking for More than coffee and McDonald's or burger king or bagels.

There are always disputes among fans of Deluca's, Pamela's, and the rest.  This is my favorite all around breakfast place based on my enjoyment of a working man's breakfast, the old greasy spoon, if you will.  I'm talking old school, blue color Pittsburgh style.  A place where one meal can get you through the day, with the help of some antacids of course.  Servings are large, hearty, and filling.  Always enjoyed hitting this place up on a Saturday morning following a late night with friends.  My favorites are the Eggs Benedict on that local Mancini's Italian, the Mixed Grill, and the Cherry Coke's flavored with their own syrup.

This is the best diner breakfast in Pittsburgh. It is always packed but they move people through relatively quickly - not to mention it's well worth the wait! Their omelettes are huge, the food always comes quickly and hot, and the service is always exceptional. 10/10 would recommend.
Just spent 60 bucks for breakfast and it was terrible! Won't never ever be back.... I guess I should have drank the free beer.....

Had to visit this diner on my first trip to Pittsburgh. We waited outside in the rain but it wasn't too long. Inside was so cute and cozy and everyone was so friendly. We were seated in the back away from the hustle and bustle and we were able to enjoy a huge greasy breakfast. Ordered: Western omelette, short stack of cinnamon bun pancakes, blackberry blintzes and a side of bacon. Everything was good, especially the blintzes. The blackberries on the blintzes were ginormous. When we commented on them, the server brought us some even bigger ones on the side. Coffee was excellent, not bitter at all. Liked this place a lot!
Hometown favorite! Line out the door but table turnover was quick! In-season right now are pumpkin pancakes! Yum!

Excellent breakfasts in a old fashioned dive atmosphere. Even had a healthier option: Had an excellent frittata with fresh vegetables and cheese. A long wait, but classic large-sized plates full of good food. Affordable to boot.

This is a must for breakfast in the Pittsburgh Strip District! I have never tried them, but they have many kinds of dessert pancakes. Lots of breakfast options. Can be busy - especially on the weekend. Great experiences there!

The food is amazing! Take your time to read the menu. SO many crazy choices. The portions are huge. Man vs. Food plays on a constant loop on some of the TVs. It's clean. Colorful. Fast service.
The Superbowl is a creative omelet filled with keilbasa, onions, tomatoes, mashed potatoes and is served with a side of sauerkraut and hot apples. Wow!
We will definitely be back.
My only complaints were the wobbly tables (we moved twice) and the freezing cold breeze from an open door in the kitchen.

It was a fun experience. The food was good, hot, and fresh. The staff were somewhat friendly. We got in and out with no wait and our food came in a reasonable amount time. To sum it up, I would try it again.

I recommend arriving at Deluca's early. I came with a group of six at about 8:45, and we were very lucky to be seated within 25 minutes as two tables opened up beside each other. By the time our food arrived, the line extended past the beyond the field of view from inside.

This time I order peanut butter pancakes with scrambled eggs and kielbasa. The eggs were good, and the pancakes and kielbasa were great. I was expecting house pancakes smeared with peanut butter but received pancakes infused with peanut butter flavor; they were soft and fluffy yet concrete in flavor; thus, the pancakes sufficed all of the principles I seeks in pancakes. The kielbasa was crispy; it was well done but not overcooked.

Previously, I've had an omelette and home fries, and I can verify that these dishes are  tasty and generously portioned.

The service was great too. As I mentioned, our larger group was quickly accommodated, our orders were taken promptly, and the food was delivered warm. The staff even offered some witty banter to a member of our group who decided to make an interesting choice for his breakfast.

I love food! I think for the most part everyone on Yelp does. This is why I wake up in the morning, this is what we all have in common, and this is why I would wait on a line for 45 minutes, for good food. The local people outside waiting like us said this place is amazing. The couple being older told us about all the local spots, but insisted we picked the right one. They also mentioned Deluca's was featured in "Jack Reacher" and on "Man vs. Food". There are other famous people that dined here, but I don't have the time to name them all. When we finally got inside we had to wait to be seated. There were empty tables but the staff moved slow. I was surprised by that, but not everyone moves like a New Yorker. My brother asked if they could hurry up and seat us but the waitress was rude and kept walking. I didn't worry about it as we were seated next. When I walked to my seat I noticed a plaque which stated "Tom Cruise" sat here. Oh boy, now I felt like I was lucky. The rude waitress ended up being our  server, how's that for Irony. She was still rude but it was ok, I am here to eat! They had so much food already cooked the wait wasn't that bad. When my meal finally came I had to wait because the waitress forgot my bacon. But when it arrived I dug right in. I am running out of words to use to describe incredible food. This breakfast was by far the best meal I have ever eaten. Words can't be put together the right way to explain the full measure on how amazing this meal was. I have no negative other then the packaged butter being to hard. I am so annoyed with finding these gems and not having them in New York. If I come to Pittsburgh again this will be my number one breakfast stop. I just need to bring a bigger pair of jeans.

Service was very slow. Waitress was yelling across the restaurant to other employees drawing attention to a mishap that customers need not know anything about. It took nearly 45 minutes before we were seen again to place our order. I had the MOAB. The burrito had nearly half of an uncooked onion in it. Along with an entire steamed tomato. The kitchen was not busy as they are in plain view so that isn't a reason for this poor culinary mistake. My wife ordered a sandwich and was given a wrap. All in all I am disappointed in my experience at delucas because people always speak so highly of it. I don't recommend going to this location. Stick to the strip district delucas.

We were going to be down in the strip so we thought we would try this place since I have heard so much about it. Just in case you forgot, the parking in the strip is terrible to say the least. We got there about 9:00 am. Sunday morning. The line was out the door and down the street. It took us about 30 minutes to get a seat. The portions were large and if you wanted huge portions, they had those options on the menu too. The sausage biscuit and gravy was lacking the sausage. There was only two small crumbles of sausage. The lobster bisque was lacking substance too. The taste was really good except that the few  pieces of seafood that were in it, were smaller than a grain of rice. I expected more. Our silverware was sad looking. I had to straighten my fork so all the prongs were even. It just seems like they are so busy that they quit caring about the quality. I don't know how this restaurant has been here so long and is still this busy.

I'm never too impressed with this diner. It's okay, but really nothing special. I ordered this grilled veggie and egg breakfast, assuming it would be a breakfast bowl kind of thing. As it turned out, it was a giant plate of mushy, unseasoned vegetables (90% of that being onion) with a little pile of eggs on top. The eggs weren't even beaten before they were cooked because they were full of visible whites. Biscuits were ok. I've had regular eggs, potatoes & toast before which was a better experience, so maybe I'll avoid anything besides a classic breakfast from now on.

I frequently stop at DeLuca's for breakfast. This visit, I opted to try a lunch item. I was not disappointed!! I ordered this club sandwich- the bread was thick and there was plenty of turkey and bacon. F you're going during breakfast hours, especially on the weekend, be prepared to wait. The wait is definitely worth it. I highly recommend the Steel City Breakfast of Champs

I was extremely excited to come to Deluca's for a morning breakfast.  After seeing it on Man vs Food and hearing that it is one of Pittsburgh's best places for breakfast, how can I not be excited.  However, leaving the bustling breakfast place, I found myself very disappointed.

I did my research before I came here.  My mother and I only had one more day together before I went back to school, and I wanted the meal to be great.  I knew what I wanted to order before I even opened the front door to the place: the Seafood Omelette.

I made this decision based mostly off of my love for seafood and avocado.  However, when I got the dish, I was saddened

To start off with, there were only 3 little slivers of avocado spaced on top of the massive omelette.  You would think for the $13 I would get a little more, but I let it go.  I then started eating the omelette.  My first bite was shrimp; then, my next bite was shrimp; then, my next bite was once again, you guessed it, shrimp.  After I was done eating, I recalled only tasted one bite of crab.  Never did my taste buds or my eyes even see any lobster.  Very Very disappointing for the most expensive omelette on the menu.

Also, the restaurant messed up my order and gave me hash browns when I wanted the tomatoes.  The hash browns were not good at all either.  My mother and I didn't even eat either side order (which is really rare that we don't eat something).  Finally, when the waitress set down my plate she said, "Oh, I will be right back with your toast."  Well, she never came back.  When she did, she was apologetic, but my mother and I had already finished our meals.  


In the place's defense, the omelette was good, but it just was not what anyone should expect from one of the most expensive items on the menu; especially when there is suppose to be lobster and crab inside.  My mothers Eggs Benedict was also very good, so no complaints with her meal, except the bad hash browns.

Like I told my mom, the 3 star rating means that I would go back and eat, but I would defiantly try somewhere else in the area before I go back.

My favorite breakfast spot in the city! Get there early on weekends to beat the crowd. Even if there is a line, it usually moves pretty fast. Coffee is hot and food options are endless. We have tried it all from omelets to French toast to burgers to crepes to pancakes. Everything we have ever eaten there has been delicious! Prices are extremely fair too. This place runs like a well oiled machine...and we can't get enough!

The hype is real. Yes the line is worth it. Get the chicken and waffles. It's a big, thin boneless breast of chicken perfectly cooked with plenty of delicious coating. Then it sits on top of a perfectly crisp waffle with a delicate sweet inside. The only chicken and waffles to surpass it is at Screen Door in Portland, Oregon.
Great food, great service and free beer! Seriously though, the best breakfast spot in Robinson!

We got there early on Sunday morning,  7:15am.  Because the line for this hot spot is insane on the weekends. 

Rightly so. Because even its breakfast proper you're not  interested in eating again until the dinner bell. 

Atmosphere is diner loud. Employees are focused, happy and active participants regarding service and quality of experience. 

The crepes are fabulous, we the apple and the lingonberry. Both generous, sweet and flavorful. Side of bacon is FOUR slices. 

The men had ginormous combos. They raved over the pancakes. But there was also eggs, hash browns, toast and breakfast meat...  a LOT of food. 

If you haven't eaten here, do it.  That impossibly long line isn't for nothing. 

Great eats. Great service.

Unique vibe. Nice food with reasonable price. A lot of food options for brunch including toasts, omelettes, pancakes, waffles, burgers, and many more. If you are in the Strip District and want to try out a decent brunch place with Pittsburgh's unique vibe, this is the place for you.

Seems like a great place to go for a hangover, but I wasn't very impressed.  We went late morning on a Saturday, so naturally there was a huge line.  The atmosphere was fun, like your typical popular, greasy spoon.  The food was just average...spicy, greasy, make you run for the bathroom, gut-busting, giant menu, heart attack-inducing joint.

Came here probably too late on a Saturday morning, and had to stand in the line out the door for maybe 30-40 minutes? (I have no concept of time, but it was a while). The man inside had said the wait would be about 15 minutes which was pretty much BS but I am glad to say it was worth it! Service was quick but not personal (those servers had zero time to chitchat, all running around like chickens with their heads cut off). The coffee was great and refilled regularly, and my boyfriend and I split the Californian omelette and chocolate chip pancakes. We ate it all and loved it! It was all perfectly portioned and we left feeling full but not disgusting. The pancakes were really special, and for those who love to over-indulge, their menu has a ton of ridiculous pancake options. Loved the vintage diner vibe but did not get the movie reference throughout.

WOAAAH I almost forgot to mention the best part! The omelette came with probably the most AMAZING sauce in the world. My boyfriend really proved his worth when he asked if we could have more on the side, and were given an entire freaking bowl of this dream sauce. Amazing stuff, it really was all in the sauce.

this place was one of my favorite diners ever. really friendly wait staff was a highlight.  there was a line friday midday, but it moved pretty fast, scared to think how long the line is on sat or sun. I got the Texmex omlette which had just a great balance of spice and flavors and was super filling. pancakes looked real good also. great representation of great Pitt dining.

Stopped in for a late breakfast and to shop the Strip. Not to be disappointed. We sat at the counter, and our drinks were immediately served. I had an egg & cheese sandwich with lettuce, tomato and onion on lightly grilled Italian bread with a side of homefries. My guy ordered his usual softly scrambled eggs, bacon and homefries. 
My coffee was pleasantly filled by attentive employees. The homefries unfortunately were cold but the quickly rectified. The bathrooms?  OMG. Remodeled!  Nicely redone and that was truly a shockeroo. Very nice. Sae a little placard ib the counter indicating the Yankees may soon be updated too. Wowee

Our fav free parking spots are now fenced off so we used the on street parking kiosk. Not bad. $3 for two hours. 

Everyone knows that this is THE breakfast spot in the Burg. Keep going because it's always good.

Rocked the chocolate chip pancakes with chocolate ice cream on top and split the huevos rancheros. Delicious! Very good food and loved the coffee. 
Unfortunately, my concern wasn't for the food, but my self esteem, as the server was both intimidating and aggressive. She kept the coffee full, but my soul empty. In her eyes was a contempt that few humans truly possess and I must admit a weight was lifted from my shoulders when I left the place. Let the PSTD begin.

While waiting for a table I said "This better be the best breakfast ever." The man in front of me said it was a very delicious breakfast. It definitely was! I had the calfornia eggs benedict, hubby had the original benedict, and THEN we ordered the strawberry fields. I know what you are thinking...

It was a LOT of food but we didn't finish it all. The eggs benedict were some of the best I've had. Spinach, tomatoes, cheese...yum. Potatoes were also great. Hubby really liked these.

The strawberry fields was OMG good. It was a lot of flavors for me but hubby loved it. I would have just been fine with a chocolate chip pancake and called it a day. lol. It had fudge, strawberry ice cream, chocolate chip pancake, and strawberries..oh and whipped cream. After that meal, we didn't eat for hours...

It was featured on man vs food for a reason!

Took my third trip to Deluca's Restaurant in the Strip District (been to the new Robinson location several times).  Eating here never gets old!! 

Ate at the counter for the first time. It was fun to watch the kitchen work.  Really makes you appreciate the cooks and the food when you see how hard and fast they are working.  I ordered "THE CALIFORNIA" omelette, it is quickly becoming my favorite.  It's an omelette loaded with avocado, tomatoes, spinach, sweet roasted red peppers, pesto chicken, and swiss cheese.  The ingredients are very fresh and not as heavy since it's essentially meatless.

They move their customers in and out at a quick pace.  Don't be intimidated by the line. Service is fast and efficient!

I've been here 3-4 times since it opened. I usually enjoy eating here more than the original in the Strip District. There's typically not a huge line or long wait at this location. Worth it to avoid touristy-nonsense and try the exact same food. They have always got me right in and right out. Food never disappoints! 

The Californian omelette is amazing! It's one of my favorites... with Chipotle Pesto Chicken, Asiago Cheese, Tomatoes, Avocado, Roasted Red Peppers & Spinach. Delicious. I highly recommend it.

This place is beyond incredible. The environment, the coffee, the service, the pancakes, the amazing breakfast potatoes with bits of semi-burnt crispiness.

Go. Now.

Well worth the 20 minute wait!  I had the caramel apple crepes and a side of hot sausage (which, yes, is SMOKING HOT)....the service was about what you'd expect for a crazy-busy Saturday morning, but everything was on point.  Can't wait for my next trip!

My PIC (Partner In Cuisine) and I went down to the Strip District one very warm Saturday morning on a whim.  We didn't know where or what we wanted to eat and down there, there are more than a few options to pick from.  Dizzy from all of the choices (and perhaps low blood sugar), we walked past Deluca's.  My PIC commented on the fact that he heard that place was "good" and it was featured on the Food Network.  He had me at "good" (granted, I don't watch Food Network).  Anywho, apparently we got there at just the right time between breakfast and lunch because we got seated immediately.  We were greeted by a detached if not surly waiter.  He was efficient in taking our orders and getting our food.  Unfortunately, we never saw him again after that (except to get our bill of course).  

Despite the mediocre service, the food iteself was excellent.  The true diner menu, with its seemingly hundreds of selections, had a breakfast highlight as all diners do.  My PIC and I happily obliged the menu and ordered two different breakfasts.  I got the biscuits and sausage gravy and he got a breakfast with gigantic pancakes.  The portions were huge and the food was tasty.  The people next to us had breakfast burritos that made our breakfasts look puny in comparison.  Or maybe it was me being star struck by the "Tom Cruise's ass was here" plaque.  We agreed that our next trip would include those (burritos, not Tom Cruise). 

Unfortunately, the last time my PIC and I tried to go to Deluca's, there was a line around the block.  We didn't feel like waiting, so we went elsewhere.  I do have to say though, that I wish we had waited in line for Deluca's instead of going "elsewhere".  That's a regret I will take to my grave.  Just wait in line at Deluca's.  It's worth it.

My favorite breakfast place in the Strip! The wait is long, the dinning room may not always look spotless, but the food has always been worth every penny.

The pecan pancakes come with a hearty amount of pecans, and the bacon medium thickness and full of juices! 

Tip, they take cash only, and the restrooms are not handicap assessable (down a flight of narrow stairs - olde building).

Deluca's you little famous gem you, so coveted that your loyal patrons and out of towners wind around the door and and down street for breakfast. What is to say that cannot already be said....

I've eaten here a couple of times, I loved the bacon it was thicker cut, plenty of it they definitely do not do wimpy portions here. This is an arggh meat and potatoes and off to work the railroad or steel mill type joint. 

I do not love their home fries or has browns, whichever they are kind of flavorless, I also did not love their huevos rancheros idea ~ why put it on the menu if it doesn't have the right beans or any beans? There are other menu options which are ok but not much diversity on the menu. Seating is tight and tiny it gets very sweaty in the summer. 

Cash only.... so be ready with a fistful of green (naw you won't really need a fistful prices are actually pretty moderate here.

We wanted to go to the original Deluca's but this was on our way out of town. Kind of a cool retro diner with good food. We ended up splitting the seafood omelet which was plenty for the two of us. To be honest the omelet was solid but nothing amazing. 

I think if you're looking for a place to have a good breakfast this is as good as any. I think I might have to try some other items on the menu to bump up this original rating.. One more reason to head back to Pittsburgh.

About a 4.5 or so... I went to DeLuca's because I saw it on MvF and I was in the area for a baseball game. I wound up getting the 2 pound breakfast burrito with bacon - I must say, I highly recommend it. The bacon at DeLuca's is VERY good, and every bit of the burrito was great. $10 may seem pretty pricey, but you get two pounds of it, and it will certainly fill you up for awhile.

This review was brought to you by the letter P.  P is for patience and I hope you have some if you're choosing DeLuca's.

My friends alerted me to the fact that they've never been to the Pittsburgh staple, DeLuca's.  So after a rough previous day/night we decided we'd venture down to the Strip and get our fill on diner breakfast at noon on a Sunday.  The line out of the door didn't sway our choice.  We were in it for the long haul and what else can you expect, it was a beautiful Sunday and people were hungry.  The four of us waited probably 20 minutes to get in and by this time we were very hungry and in desperate need of caffeine.  

The first "problem" with DeLuca's is that their menu is too expansive.  Some would view this as a problem, myself included in that I have too much of a hard time deciding what I want to shove down my gullet.  The waitress, a nice enough lady, swung by after a few minutes to get our drink orders.  A round of water and coffee please.  The drinks arrived soon there after and we finally figured out what we'd have to eat.  The place was packed so expected to wait a bit for our food and we did probably another 20-30 minutes, which was fine.  However, after finishing our coffees we weren't pleased with having to wait and wait for fill ups.  As a former waiter this is a red x with me and coupled with the black grease encased around some of my homefries knocked this heavy weight in the Pittsburgh food scene down a peg.  

I enjoyed my meal though and it was definitely a huge portion as were all my buddy's.  The fried chicken and biscuits with gravy, homefries, and eggs was exactly what I needed after a long day of brew festing and staying up way later than I am used to.  The chicken was fried very well, moist on the inside, crispy exterior even with the gravy.  Eggs were over easy as I ordered.  The biscuits were warm and tasted homemade.  And aside from a few homefries swimming in black grease from the griddle were exactly what you want in a homefry.  Some crisp with that griddle fried skin and some mushy.  

DeLuca's doesn't need any help from Yelp and won't go out of business because of this review or any other review, it's a giant because of their portions, location, and history so go if you're patient and have a hunger for something greasy.

It's breakfast what is anyone really looking for from a greasy spoon? I had the omelette with bacon, cheese and veggies. It was great. Maybe too much cheese.  But whatever it's breakfast. I say wait in line and get your breakfast. And don't bitch about the service for God's sake it's breakfast not a gourmet meal.

We went there today and it was closed.  The posted hours state they are open until 9 but the manager told everyone who wanted to eat there (about 10 or 12 of us) that due to lack of business that they close at 3.  Maybe you should change your hours on here.  He wouldn't let us talk to the owner.  Lack of business?  People kept parking, walking in the door and being turned away.  We got there before 3.
Outstanding breakfast. There will probably be a line, it's very worthwhile though. It's in the "strip district" near downtown. A wonderful area to walk around and explore.
Always great service and amazing food. It's nice they take cards here. Sitting at the counter is always the easiest and quickest way to get a seat on a busy weekend morning

I was in town for a wedding and did not get a chance to check out the food scene too much.  I did take the time to check out 2 restaurants that were on the Travel Channel.  This place was one of the 2 that I saw.

Food was great and so was the service.  I guess my only complaint would be the tight quarters.  I will definitely be back for their amazing breakfast!

Only 2/5 because you can't just order a side of eggs and bacon. My waitress said you have to get the whole meal for ~$8.50.  I think it also comes with home fries and toast, but she was rattling things off so fast I'm not quite sure. They weren't even busy yet. Seems odd to me for a diner not to have separate sides. 

Aside from that I got the pumpkin pie crepe which was great!

Overall, it's too expensive. The bill was $21.00 for eggs, bacon, and a filled crepe.  I will not be coming back.

The spot for your morning fuel in the Strip! It ain't fancy and they don't care if you are! The food is always fresh and hot, coffee the same, and everything is yummy! Terrific and HUGE omelette - try the Spanish with salsa! Great stuff - there's a reason the place is usually packed, and a reason all the folks are smiling. Great chow! Get it here! (Oh...and take cash only!)

We chose to do breakfast at DeLuca's because their website intrigued us.  Their decor was outer space themed and their menu was huge. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly staff and were seated immediately. We all had a hard time deciding what to order because their menu was so large. I ordered the breakfast burrito and per my usual requested that certain items be omitted. This was the only time in my life I will admit that I shouldn't have done that!  I was envious as I saw everyone else's burrito come out because mine was plain and boring. Overall, my party agreed the food was good but nothing to write home about. The portions are enormous though so prepare yourself. When we left, the line waiting for a table was quite long. DeLuca's was a good, quick breakfast but not somewhere I'd go regularly.

Now for the conclusion of my Deluca's adventure...



                      Insomnia, Daylight Savings Time, The Devil, and I

"Springing Forward," a lack of Kay around (she was visiting relatives out of town for the weekend), and a looming Monday morn cursed me with a fitful night of near-sleeplessness. There was however a brief, tortured dreamtime interlude in which I had a second encounter with The Adversary, he who caused me to gorge and involuntarily purge at Burgatory over 2 years ago...

              Delusions of Grandeur, The Great Beast, and Growling, Animate Grub

 From a ring of black smoke, The Adversary  introduced me to The MOAB, the MUTHA of all Burritos, and there is nothing maternal about it. The Fallen Angel and his emissary of stuffed tortilla belitted me, spat at me, and became intangible when I attempted to thrash them. "You'll never finish it," The Adversary derisively shouted, his voice sounding like broken glass as the lumpen ogre that is the MOAB uttered gutteral, gutter epithets.

                                         Destroy My Digestive System At Dawn

My skin clammy, and my stomach somewhat queasy, I foolishly leapt from my bed, washed up, dressed and headed to The Strip to defeat a burrito. I arrived ten minutes early and waited patiently to enter. Once I did, however, MOAB and The Adversary decided to play mindgames with me, telling me that I could get my hands on either of them IF I bested both an omelet and a dessert pancake. It would be a handicap match with a stipulation too gratifying to resist. 

"In this corner, weighing in at a combined weight of err...several pounds, and seconded by The Adversary and MUTHA of All Burritos, the team of Captain Drew's Seafood Omelet and The Funky Monkey Pancakes."

The crowd jeered, eagerly awaiting the arrival of the hero...

*Entrance music*

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Uu4emT6btH4

"Coming to the ring and weighing in at 210 pounds, he is Proletarian Steel, ladies and gentleman, Darren W!" 

The crowd stands and collectively roar like a turbine. 10,000 feet meet the arena floor, making the sound of a marching army. The pancake dish is a tower of terror constructed from 3 chocolate-chip banana pancakes, whipped cream, hot fudge, and golden vanilla ice cream, and it attacked first, punishing me with carbohydrates, sludgy cocoa, cream, and frozen dairy products. As I was halfway finished with it, in came Captain Drew's Seafood Omelet to blindside me. Topped with avocado chunks, a buttery Hollandaise (one of the better Hollaindaise sauces I've had at area restaurants) and suffused with garlic sauteed Langostinos, lump crabmeat, phat-ass shrimp, and an Asiago/Swiss cheese blend, the newspaper-roll omelete threatened to engulf me in eggy, yellow oblivion, yet I munched and chomped my way to victory, hitting Captain Drew with a quick spear to get the pinfall while Funky Monkey was dumped outside of the ring via a fireman's carry. 

Those pancakes however...

Perhaps it was that I was running out of time or that the ice cream was heavy and rich enough on its own, but I was only able to eat 2/3 of it. Call it a non-contest after The Adversary and MOAB interfered and TV time expired, but not being able to fight them all off, I was quadruple-teamed, taking The Adversary's cane in the stomach along with several splashes. The Adversary and MOAB would then "cut a promo" promising to clog and crush my "working-class chump heart" as I was carried away by officials. 

"You did good," said my spry, affable, and conscientous waitress (she reheated my sourdough toast when it had gotten cold). "Most people would never be able to eat all that food." 

"Eh, I wish I hadn't," I told her. "It was real good, though."

But I'll be back. I've a vendetta on my shoulders.

Weeks ago, something deep in my subconscious told me to stop in this new DeLuca's restaurant to end an unfinished grudge while returning home from a doctor's appointment. 

As icy gales of illwill  ripped across Western Pennsylvania, The Adversary contemplated his next, ultimate assault, conferring with MOAB, The Mutha of All Burritos while reflecting on past encounters at two Burgatory satellites and the original Strip District DeLuca's. . .

"In this new Robinson locale, I shall crush Proletarian Steel forever more! What say you, burrito?" The Adversary asked his hulking, simple-minded, single-minded champion.

"MOAB izzz constipation. MOAB izzz indigestion. MOAB izzz heartburn. MOAB izzz doooooommmm!!!" The creature of chorizo, eggs, hot peppers, tomatoes, onions, avocado, cheddar, and homefries uttered, sounding like a trash compactor. A chile sauce of DeLuca's own making that was both saccharine and piquant bled a Satanic crimson all over MOAB's doughy, pale body as the Adversary cackled into the killing frost. Gazing into his magic mirror, The Adversary could see Kay and I en route to Pittsburgh from a doctor's visit in Chippewa. 

"They're coming," The Adversary, clad in a coal-black suit, tie, and fedora, mentioned to MOAB. 

"This Darren fellow, he barely lasted against the titanic tandem of Captain Drew's Seafood Omelet and the Funky Monkey Pancake stack. MOAB, you may be enough to finish him."

As Kay and I entered the 50's sci-fi themed diner, taking in the galactic, Atomic Age murals that adorned the interiors along with the silver and red motif of the furniture. 

The Adversary appeared without warning amidst a cloud of inky smoke. 

"This shall be our final meeting, our last duel, a dance...to the death!!!"

Kay was immediately subdued by hooded figures. 

"Your love shall watch you perish," the funereal man warned. "Ah, the rings of Saturn...they are so appropriate. This will be my hour of cosmic evil! Attack, my minion!!!" 

MOAB charged. Howling and snorting like a gigantic prehistoric boar, it knocked me to the cruel floor. Patrons gasped, fleeing in panic! 

Once I regathered my strength and wits, I both blinded and suffocated the behemoth with packets of sour cream, taming its heat. When it hunched over, I leapt upon MOAB's back with gleaming utensils and plunged them into the beast's body as a matador would a bull. Proteins, starches, vegetables, dairy products, and grains would fly about the eatery turned gladiatorial arena. Within 15 minutes, MOAB was gone, and I belched in victory. 

"What else ya got, Scratch?" I asked. 

Stammering, the Adverary replied. "An insurance policy..."

The Funky Monkey Sundae arose from a trap door. 

"Ha. Its big brother, the pancake stack, musta chickened out considering I pretty much whupped him." I said with a confident air. 

Cursing, The Adversary, ordered the sundae to charge me with the point of a clawed finger. A carnal chimera of chocolate ice cream, bananas, whipped cream, peanut butter, and caramel slithered forward to meet its destiny. Ice cream headaches nothwithstanding, the glass dish would be emptied, and the salty, sugary, creamy dessert would be overcome. 

Steam shooting from his nostrils, The Adversary telekinetically hurled planets at me with waves of his ghastly, skeletal hands. While I dodged the large constructs that had been thrown my way, Kay would use judo to toss both hooded henchmen into the Slim Onyx Count, ruining his concentration.
